          <h1 id="introduction">Introduction</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>The Eagle Eye Video API is a comprehensive RESTful API for recording, indexing and storing camera video. The Eagle Eye Video API handles all the <em>heavy lifting</em> of interfacing with the cameras, recording video, securely transmitting video to the cloud, storing video and making video available for use for your applications. All of the Eagle Eye Security Camera VMS user interfaces (web, iOS, Android) have been built using this API</p>

<p>We provide language bindings in cURL. You can view code examples on the right-hand side <em>window</em> and you can switch the programming language of the examples with the tabs in the top right (when available)</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="getting-started">Getting Started</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>The Eagle Eye Video API allows you to securely record, manage and play video back from any camera, any place, any time. A robust annotation interface and smart bandwidth management allows you to turn terabytes of raw video into searchable, useful data</p>

<p>Since the API is based on REST principles, itâ€™s very easy to write and test applications. You can use your browser to access URLs and you can use many different HTTP clients in nearly any programming language</p>

<h3 id="requirements">Requirements</h3>

<ul>
<li>TLS 1.2 or greater</li>
</ul>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="get-an-api-key">Get an API Key</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h3 id="create-a-developer-account">Create a Developer Account</h3>

<aside><form action="https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/api_signup.html"><button>&#9654; Create Developer Account</button></form></aside>

<p>To get started with the Eagle Eye Video API you will need an <em>API Key</em>. This is used to identify you and your application. It also makes everything secure. To get an <em>API Key</em> you will need an account (so that you have some place to do some testing). You can either use your existing account or create a <em>Developer Account</em>. You can create an <em>API Key</em> in your existing account under the <em>Account Settings</em></p>

<p>You will have to verify your email address to create your <em>Developer Account</em>. You will also get an email with a shortcut to create the <em>API Key</em>. Click on the shortcut link to create your <em>API Key</em> and get started writing some code</p>

<p>You may also want to purchase a development hardware kit from us (so you can connect some devices). These are available at a large discount for developers. You can get an Eagle Eye <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Bridge')">Bridge</a> and even some <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera')">Cameras</a> from us for development and testing. Just email us for more information and pricing</p>

<!-- TODO: Maybe provide a contact email address for the sales department -->

<p>The <em>API Key</em> should be located in the header under the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;Authorization&#39;</code> key with a colon appended to it</p>

<aside class="notice">User password authentication is still required</aside>

<p>Please see the section on <a href="#single-sign-on">Single Sign On</a> for alternatives to password authentication</p>

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

</tr>
<tr>

</tr>

          <h1 id="authentication">Authentication</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Gaining access to the Eagle Eye API is a two-stage process. <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Client')">Clients</a> first present their credentials and Realm to obtain a single-use <em>Authentication Token</em>. This single use token is valid for a predefined duration or until it has been used. Once the Authentication Token is obtained the Client must utilize it in an Authorize service call to obtain a session ID (via the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key&#39;</code> cookie) that provides access to resources. This two-phase approach allows Clients to authenticate and operate in multiple domains. The first step is done using Authenticate. The second step is done using Authorize. Note that the Authenticate call must be done over a HTTPS connection</p>

<p>In addition to the Simple Authentication described above, a more <em>secure</em> Authentication method known as <strong>Two-Factor Authentication</strong> (<strong>TFA</strong>) may be used. TFA is a method of confirming the user&rsquo;s identity by utilizing a combination of two different components. The first component is a user&rsquo;s password and the second is a one-time TFA code delivered to the user via another communication channel - email or a text message sent to the user&rsquo;s mobile phone</p>

<p>Whether Simple or Two-Factor Authentication is used for a particular user&rsquo;s login is determined by this user&rsquo;s settings in the system. Note, however, that an <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account-Superuser')">Account Superuser</a> may enforce all users in a particular <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account')">Account</a> to use TFA</p>

<p>If TFA is enforced, the Authorize call will expect the TFA code to be passed in addition to the token obtained from the Authenticate call</p>

<p>There are several methods to use the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key&#39;</code> cookie (obtained from the Authorize call) to authenticate subsequent API calls:</p>

<ul>
<li>The first is to simply pass the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key&#39;</code> <em>cookie</em> with all API requests</li>
<li>The second is to take the value of the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key&#39;</code> cookie and pass it in the request as the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;A&#39;</code> <em>parameter</em> <br><small>(The <code class="prettyprint">&#39;A=[AUTH_KEY]&#39;</code> parameter can be used with any method (<em>GET</em>, <em>PUT</em>, <em>POST</em>, <em>DELETE</em>))</small></li>
</ul>

<p>The order of precedence for session ID retrieval is as follows:</p>

<ol>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;A&#39;</code> parameter in the query string of any method (<em>GET</em>, <em>PUT</em>, <em>POST</em>, <em>DELETE</em>)</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;A&#39;</code> parameter in the <em>POST</em> data</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;A&#39;</code> parameter in the request body (e.g. <em>PUT</em>)</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key&#39;</code> cookie</li>
</ol>

<p><strong>Note:</strong> HTTP response status codes are listed throughout the document in order of precedence with the <em>request successfully completed</em> codes at the very end - meaning amongst the <em>negative result codes</em> the last one listed is the one that will be returned if none of the preceding codes&rsquo; conditions are met</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="1-authenticate">1. Authenticate</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Login is a two-step process when using Simple Authentication and a three-step process using TFA</p>

<h3 id="simple-authentication">Simple Authentication</h3>

<ol>
<li>Authenticate with username and password</li>
<li>Authorize with the token returned by Authenticate</li>
</ol>

<h3 id="two-factor-authentication">Two-Factor Authentication</h3>

<ol>
<li>Authenticate</li>
<li>Instruct the system to send the TFA code</li>
<li>Authorize with the token received from <strong><em>1.</em></strong> and the TFA code received from <strong><em>2.</em></strong></li>
</ol>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/authenticate <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"username": "[USERNAME]", "password": "[PASSWORD]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/authenticate</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>username</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>The username defined by the user (email address)</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>password</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>The password defined by the user (alphanumeric, min 10 characters)</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<blockquote>
<p>Json Response (Simple Authentication)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"token"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p>Json Response (Two-Factor Authentication)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"token"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"two_factor_authentication_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"sms"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"*** *** 779"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"email"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"***********@gmail.com"</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-response-json-attributes">HTTP Response (Json Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameters</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>token</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Token to be used in Authorize</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>two_factor_authentication_code</td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Defines which method can be used for TFA code delivery: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;sms&#39;</code> - scrubbed user&rsquo;s SMS number <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;email&#39;</code> - scrubbed user&rsquo;s email address <br><br>(present only if TFA is enabled, displays partial information about the defined email address or phone number)</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p><strong><em>NOTE 1:</em></strong></p>

<p>Token expiration:</p>

<ul>
<li><em>30 seconds</em> for Simple Authentication</li>
<li><em>15 minutes</em> for TFA</li>
</ul>

<p><strong><em>NOTE 2:</em></strong></p>

<p>For TFA, the system uses the parameter <code class="prettyprint">&#39;sms_phone&#39;</code> from the <a href="#user-model">User Model</a>
<br>If SMS-based authentication is to be used, that parameter must be specified at the user&rsquo;s creation time (See <a href="#create-user">Create User</a>)
<br>If user&rsquo;s parameter <code class="prettyprint">&#39;sms_phone&#39;</code> has not been set, the value of the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;sms&#39;</code> key will be <code class="prettyprint">&#39;No sms phone found&#39;</code></p>

<p><strong><em>NOTE 3:</em></strong></p>

<p>The TFA-related user&rsquo;s data (i.e. SMS phone or email), once set at the time of user&rsquo;s account creation, can only be modified by that user alone. Any such modification will also be TFA authenticated. Account superuser cannot change this data for security reasons</p>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>User has been authenticated (Body contains Json-formatted result)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Invalid credentials supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>402</td>
<td>Account is suspended</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>460</td>
<td>Account is inactive</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>461</td>
<td>Account is pending</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>412*</td>
<td>User is disabled</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>462</td>
<td>User is pending (This will be thrown before 401 if the username is valid and account is active)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>465</td>
<td>IP Address Invalid</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p>*Code 412 is also returned if TFA is used and the user&rsquo;s account has been locked due to more than 3 failed attempts to authorize with a TFA code</p>

<h2 id="2-send-tfa-code-only-if-using-tfa">2. Send TFA Code (<small>only if using TFA</small>)</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This step is only to be executed when TFA is used for the user log in (i.e. if the Authenticate call returned <code class="prettyprint">&#39;two_factor_authentication_code&#39;</code> key in response). Otherwise proceed to <em>Step 3: Authorize</em></p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request (Two-Factor Authentication)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-D</span> - <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/two_factor_authenticate <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"token": "[TOKEN]", "two_factor_authentication_type": "[TFA_TYPE]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<!-- TODO: Verify the above TFA curl request -->

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/two_factor_authenticate</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>token</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Token received in <em>Step 1</em></td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>two_factor_authentication_type</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>TFA type: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;sms&#39;</code> - TFA code will be sent via SMS <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;email&#39;</code> - TFA code will be sent via email</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-response">HTTP Response</h3>

<p>This API call does not return data in response</p>

<p><strong><em>NOTE 1:</em></strong></p>

<p>TFA code expiration is <em>15 minutes</em></p>

<h3 id="response-status-codes">Response Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded (TFA code has been sent to the user)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>412</td>
<td>Unable to send TFA code with the TFA type selected</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>415</td>
<td>Specified TFA type not supported</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="3-authorize">3. Authorize</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Authorize is the final step of the login process performed by utilizing the token from Authenticate and (if TFA is enabled) the TFA code delivered to the user by SMS or email. A successful Authorize call returns an authorized user object and sets the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key&#39;</code> cookie. For all subsequent API calls either the <em>cookie</em> can be set or the value of it can be sent as the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;A&#39;</code> <em>parameter</em>. When TFA is used, this call will also set the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;tfa_key&#39;</code> cookie (See <a href="#authorized-devices">Authorized devices</a> for more details)</p>

<p>API calls can initially be done against <code class="prettyprint">&#39;https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com&#39;</code> (The host url), but after the authorization response is returned, API calls should then use the <strong>branded subdomain</strong>. At this stage the branded host url will become <code class="prettyprint">&#39;https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com&#39;</code>, where the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_brand_subdomain&#39;</code> field is returned in the authorization response</p>

<p>Following the authorization in the example on the right, the host url should be changed to: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;https://c001.eagleyenetworks.com&#39;</code></p>

<p><a id="active-brand-subdomain-explanation"></a>
Each account will consistently have the same <em>branded subdomain</em> and as such will not change throughout the life of the session. Caching the subdomain is safe as long as the client software validates against the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_brand_subdomain&#39;</code> after authorization. Using the <em>branded subdomain</em> is important for speed and robustness</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request (Simple Authentication)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-D</span> - <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/authorize <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"token": "[TOKEN]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p>Request (Two-Factor Authentication)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-D</span> - <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/authorize <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"token": "[TOKEN]", "two_factor_authentication_code": "[TFA_CODE]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<!-- TODO: Verify the above TFA curl requests -->

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/authorize</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>token</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Token received in <em>Authenticate</em></td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>two_factor_authentication_code</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>4 decimal digits <br>Used only for TFA (Not during Simple Authentication)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p><strong><em>NOTE 1:</em></strong></p>

<p>More than 3 failed attempts to Authorize with TFA code will lock the user&rsquo;s account. It then can only be unlocked by Eagle Eye&rsquo;s technical support staff
When the user&rsquo;s account has been locked the user is notified of this fact by email</p>

<h3 id="http-response-json-attributes">HTTP Response (Json Attributes)</h3>

<p>When successful, this API call returns Json data structure following the <a href="#user-model">User Model</a> with the additional <code class="prettyprint">&#39;user_id&#39;</code> field, which is present during Authorize and is identical to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;id&#39;</code></p>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<p><strong>When using Simple Authentication</strong></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>User has been authorized for access to the realm</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Invalid token supplied</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p><strong>When using TFA</strong></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>User has been authorized for access to the realm</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Invalid token supplied, missing TFA code or attempting to authorize with expired TFA code</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>406</td>
<td>Invalid TFA supplied or invalid TFA and invalid token supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>429</td>
<td>This user&rsquo;s account has been locked due to more than 3 failed attempts to Authorize</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="forced-vs-optional-tfa">Forced vs. Optional TFA</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Depending whether the account to which the user belongs enforces TFA or not, the user may be able to select Simple Authentication for their future <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-User-Login')">Logins</a> rather than TFA</p>

<p>In order to find out whether the account enforces TFA examine the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_two_factor_authentication_forced&#39;</code> flag in the account record returned by the <a href="#get-account">Get Account</a> API Call. This flag can be set or cleared by the account superuser with the <a href="#update-account">Update Account</a> API call</p>

<p>If the account TFA flag is set as follows <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_two_factor_authentication_forced=0&#39;</code>, the user is allowed switch to Simple Authentication. That is achieved by clearing <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_two_factor_authentication_enabled=1&#39;</code> flag in the user record. This action can only be done by the user themselves (not by an account superuser)</p>

<p>Update of any TFA-related field in the user record is performed through a dedicated TFA update endpoint: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/g/aaa/two_factor_authenticate/update&#39;</code></p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="tfa-update">TFA Update</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Data present in the user record that affects the TFA is security-sensitive and therefore may only be altered using a dedicated endpoint, whose operation is itself TFA protected. This data includes three fields in the user model:</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Field</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Remarks</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>sms_phone</strong></td>
<td>Phone number to which text messages (SMS) containing TFA code will be delivered</td>
<td>Can only be changed when using SMS for TFA code delivery <br>Code will be delivered to the new phone number</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>email</strong></td>
<td>E-mail address to which messages containing TFA code will be delivered</td>
<td>Can only be changed when using email for TFA code delivery <br> Code will be delivered to the new email address</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>is_two_factor_authentication_enabled</strong></td>
<td>1 - required to authenticate via TFA <br>0 - authenticate via Simple Authentication</td>
<td>Can be updated with either SMS or email delivery of TFA code</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<aside class="notice">The fields above can only be changed one at a time</aside>

<h3 id="tfa-update-is-a-two-step-process">TFA Update is a two-step process:</h3>

<h3 id="1-request-update">1. Request Update</h3>

<p>This step initiates the TFA data update process</p>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/two_factor_authenticate/update</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>two_factor_authentication_type</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Defines which method to use for TFA code delivery to verify this update request: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;sms&#39;</code> - TFA code will be sent via SMS <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;email&#39;</code> - TFA code will be sent via email</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>password</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>The user&rsquo;s password</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>update_json</strong></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json structure containing the name of the updated field and its new value <br><br>(Only one field can be updated at a time) <br><br>Example: <br><code class="prettyprint">{</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;sms_phone&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;+123456789&#39;</code><br><code class="prettyprint">}</code></td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-response">HTTP Response</h3>

<p>This API call returns no data</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded (Proceed to verification)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied (i.e. update of <code class="prettyprint">&#39;sms_phone&#39;</code> is requested with <code class="prettyprint">&#39;two_factor_authentication_type&#39;</code> set to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;email&#39;</code> or vice versa)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Invalid credentials supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>415</td>
<td>Invalid TFA code delivery method supplied in <code class="prettyprint">&#39;two_factor_authentication_type&#39;</code></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="2-verify-update-request-with-tfa">2. Verify update request with TFA</h3>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/two_factor_authenticate/verify</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>two_factor_authentication_code</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>The 4-digit code received via SMS or email</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-response">HTTP Response</h3>

<p>This API call returns no data</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>406</td>
<td>Invalid TFA code supplied</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="authorized-devices">Authorized Devices</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>In order to make the log-in process as convenient as possible for the user, the system will allow Simple Authentication on devices previously used by that user for a successful TFA-based log in</p>

<p>Upon a successful TFA-based log in, the <strong>Authorize</strong> API call sets a cookie <code class="prettyprint">&#39;tfa_key&#39;</code> in the browser. Subsequent execution of the <strong>Authenticate</strong> API Call with the correct username and password will initiate the Simple Authentication process, which can be differentiated from TFA by absence of the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;two_factor_authentication_code&#39;</code> field in the response of Authenticate. In this scenario the <strong>Send TFA Code</strong> API call can be skipped and the Authorize API call can be executed directly as via the non-TFA-enabled login</p>

<p><strong><em>NOTE 1:</em></strong></p>

<p>The same <code class="prettyprint">&#39;tfa_key&#39;</code> value may be applied for multiple users, who have successfully authorized in the past from the particular device</p>

<p><strong><em>NOTE 2:</em></strong></p>

<p>The list of authorized devices for any user is stored in the field <code class="prettyprint">&#39;user_authenticated_clients&#39;</code> in the user record (See <a href="#user-model">User Model</a>)</p>

          <h1 id="aaa">AAA</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This service enables the creation of new Independent Accounts and provides the means to recover them. If you are creating <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Sub-Account')">Sub-Accounts</a> tied to your current <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account')">Account</a> refer to the <a href="#account">Account</a> section</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<!-- ## Create Account -->

<h2 id=create-account-h2>Create Account</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Create a new account and the superuser for the account. As a part of the creation process, the service sends a confirmation email containing a link (with <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account-ID')">Account ID</a> and activation token), which the user must click to activate the account (cannot be used until it is activated)</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/create_account <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"email=[EMAIL]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"password=[PASSWORD]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-v</span>
</code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/create_account</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>email</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Email address</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>password</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Password</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Account name</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>realm</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Realm (defaults to current user&rsquo;s realm)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>first_name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>User first name</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>last_name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>User last name</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>timezone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Timezone name (defaults to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Pacific&#39;</code>)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_api_access_needed</td>
<td>boolean</td>
<td>Grant API access to this new account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>

<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>

</tr>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>406</td>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="validate-account">Validate Account</h2>

<h2 id="1-forgot-password">1. Forgot Password</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Password recovery is a multi-step process:</p>

<ol>
<li>Forgot Password requests a reset email to be sent to the email address of a registered user</li>
<li>Check Password Reset Token verifies whether the reset token is valid (This step is optional but is provided to allow for a friendlier user experience)</li>
<li>Reset Password allows the user to change the password (This step directly verifies whether the supplied token is a valid reset token). The result is that a user session is created for the user</li>
</ol>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/forgot_password <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"email=[EMAIL]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-v</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/forgot_password</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>email</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Email address</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>202</td>
<td>A reset email has been sent to the supplied email address. This status will be provided even if the email address was not found. This prevents attacks to discover user accounts</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>402</td>
<td>Account is suspended</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>406</td>
<td>Information supplied could not be verified</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>412</td>
<td>User is disabled</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>460</td>
<td>Account is inactive</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>461</td>
<td>Account is pending</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>462</td>
<td>User is pending</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>465</td>
<td>IP Address Invalid</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h3 id="validation-of-the-new-password-against-accounts-password-rules">Validation of the new password against Account&rsquo;s password rules</h3>

<blockquote>
<p>Response Json object with failed requirements for the new password:</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"status_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">400</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"message"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"New password does not meet all of the requirements."</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"data"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"failed_requirements"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"same_password"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
              </span><span class="nl">"description"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"New password cannot be the same as the old one."</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"length"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"description"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Password length must be between 12 and 126 characters long."</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"required_value"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                    </span><span class="nl">"minimum_length"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                    </span><span class="nl">"maximum_length"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">126</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"reuse"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"description"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Previous passwords cannot be reused."</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"required_special_char"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"description"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"New password needs to contain at least one symbol."</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"required_numeric_char"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"description"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"New password needs to contain at least one number."</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"exclude_username"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"description"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"New password should not contain the username."</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"reason"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"InvalidPassword"</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>If a new password fails against some of the Account&rsquo;s password requirements, HTTP response with status code 400 and JSON object will be returned.</p>

<p>Most password management settings require feature flag, if you want to enable it ask support.</p>

<p>More details on Password management rules can be found <a href="#account-password_management_rules">here</a>.</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="resend-registration-email">Resend Registration Email</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>For users who have registered for an account, but never confirmed the registration. This will allow the registration confirmation email to be re-sent</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/resend_registration_email <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"email=[EMAIL]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-v</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/resend_registration_email</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>email</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Email address of the account contact for a pending account</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>realm</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Realm (defaults to current user&rsquo;s realm)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>202</td>
<td>Account was located and verified to be in the pending state. A registration email has been recreated and sent to the provided email address</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>402</td>
<td>Account is suspended</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>Account with this email address and realm could not be found</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>409</td>
<td>Account is already active (not pending)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>412</td>
<td>User is disabled</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>460</td>
<td>Account is inactive</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>

<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>email</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Email address of the new user</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>realm</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Realm (defaults to current user&rsquo;s realm)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>202</td>
<td>User was located and verified to be in the pending state. A verification email has been recreated and sent to the provided email address</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>402</td>
<td>Account is suspended</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>User with this email address and realm could not be found</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>409</td>
<td>User is already active (not pending)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>412</td>
<td>User is disabled</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>460</td>

</tr>

<h2 id="change-password">Change Password</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This allows a user to change their password directly while authenticated and also allows super users to change the password of the users they manage:</p>

<ul>
<li>While changing the own password, the current password needs to be provided as well (User ID should be omitted)</li>
<li>While changing the password of one of the managed users only the new password is required (aside from the managed user&rsquo;s ID)</li>
</ul>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/change_password <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"password=[PASSWORD]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"current_password=[CURRENT_PASSWORD]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/change_password</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>password</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>New password (alphanumeric, min 10 characters)</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-User-ID')">User ID</a> of the user having their password changed (Defaults to the ID of the authenticated user). If empty or equal to authenticated user, then <code class="prettyprint">&#39;current_password&#39;</code> becomes required</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>current_password</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Current password of the user. If <code class="prettyprint">&#39;id&#39;</code> argument is empty or equal to the authenticated user&rsquo;s ID, then this is required</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<blockquote>
<p>Json Response</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"ca02c000"</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-response-json-attributes">HTTP Response (Json Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-User-ID')">User ID</a> of the user having their password changed</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>User password was changed successfully</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>User with the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;id&#39;</code> provided cannot be found</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>406</td>
<td>The <code class="prettyprint">&#39;current_password&#39;</code> provided does not match the password of the authenticated user</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h2 id="switch-account">Switch Account</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Allows a user to &lsquo;log in&rsquo; to another account which the they have access to (see <a href="#get-list-of-accounts">Get List of Accounts</a>). Most commonly this would be needed for a master account user accessing their sub-accounts. Only applicable to accounts from the <a href="#account">Account</a> model</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/switch_account <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"account_id=[ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-v</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/switch_account</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>account_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account-ID')">Account ID</a> of the account to login to. Defaults to the account which the user belongs to</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Account context switch successful</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>Account with the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;account_id&#39;</code> provided cannot be found</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="single-sign-on">Single Sign On</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<aside class="warning">Available only for branded accounts.</aside>

<p>SSO allows a reseller to maintain account management and act as an identity provider to have their system proxy the authorization requests to Eagle Eye Network servers after users have logged into the identity providers system.
This is done through the standard SAML V2.0 (Security Assertion Markup Language)</p>

<aside class="notice">This functionality requires a feature flag, if you want to enable it ask support.</aside>

<h3 id="authenticate-request">Authenticate request</h3>

<p>Request authentication from an Identity Provider Service. (Service provider initiated SSO)</p>

<h4 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h4>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://&lt;branded_sub_domain&gt;.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/sso/SAML2/SSO</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>identity_provider</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Name of the account&rsquo;s branded subdomain, which is linked with Identity Provider settings</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_recycle_session</td>
<td>boolean</td>
<td>If true and the user is already logged in, redirect the user to its account, without authenticating with the Identity Provider</td>
<td>false</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>RelayState</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>URL the Service Provider should redirect to after successful sign-on</td>
<td>false</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>account_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Account id, which holds Identity Provider settings</td>
<td>false</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p>After the successful creation of SAML AuthnRequest, redirection to the Identity Provider is going to be made.<br>
If a user is authenticated in the Identity Provider Service, redirection to the Service Provider ACS (Assertion Consumer Service) is going to be made.</p>

<aside class="notice">This functionality requires a feature flag, if you want to enable it ask support.</aside>

<h3 id="acs-assertion-consumer-service">ACS (Assertion Consumer Service)</h3>

<blockquote>
<p>Decoded SAML response example</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight xml tab-xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;saml2p:Response</span> 
    <span class="na">Destination=</span><span class="s">"https://branded_subsomain.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/sso/SAML2/Authenticate"</span> 
    <span class="na">ID=</span><span class="s">"id8972425978818166328589959"</span> 
    <span class="na">IssueInstant=</span><span class="s">"2019-11-05T16:53:17.411Z"</span> 
    <span class="na">Version=</span><span class="s">"2.0"</span> 
    <span class="na">xmlns:saml2p=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol"</span> 
    <span class="na">xmlns:xs=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    ...
    <span class="nt">&lt;saml2:Assertion</span> 
        <span class="na">ID=</span><span class="s">"id89724259788888402047455941"</span> 
        <span class="na">IssueInstant=</span><span class="s">"2019-11-05T16:53:17.411Z"</span> 
        <span class="na">Version=</span><span class="s">"2.0"</span> 
        <span class="na">xmlns:saml2=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion"</span> 
        <span class="na">xmlns:xs=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;saml2:Issuer</span> 
            <span class="na">Format=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:entity"</span> 
            <span class="na">xmlns:saml2=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>exk1huy3reR4Fs9gL357
        <span class="nt">&lt;/saml2:Issuer&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;ds:Signature</span> 
            <span class="na">xmlns:ds=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;ds:SignedInfo&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;ds:CanonicalizationMethod</span> 
                    <span class="na">Algorithm=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#"</span><span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;ds:SignatureMethod</span> 
                    <span class="na">Algorithm=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1"</span><span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;ds:Reference</span> 
                    <span class="na">URI=</span><span class="s">"#id89724259788888402047455941"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
                    <span class="nt">&lt;ds:Transforms&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;ds:DigestMethod</span> 
                        <span class="na">Algorithm=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1"</span><span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
                    <span class="nt">&lt;ds:DigestValue&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/ds:DigestValue&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;/ds:Reference&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;/ds:SignedInfo&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;ds:SignatureValue&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/ds:SignatureValue&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;ds:KeyInfo&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;ds:X509Data&gt;</span>
                    <span class="nt">&lt;ds:X509Certificate&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/ds:X509Certificate&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;/ds:X509Data&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;/ds:KeyInfo&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;/ds:Signature&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;saml2:Subject</span> 
            <span class="na">xmlns:saml2=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;saml2:NameID</span> 
                <span class="na">Format=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>orion@belt.com
            <span class="nt">&lt;/saml2:NameID&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;saml2:SubjectConfirmation</span> 
                <span class="na">Method=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:cm:bearer"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>

        <span class="nt">&lt;saml2:AuthnStatement</span>

            <span class="na">SessionIndex=</span><span class="s">"id1572972797411.929762837"</span> 
            <span class="na">xmlns:saml2=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>

                    <span class="na">xmlns:xs=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"</span> 
                    <span class="na">xmlns:xsi=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"</span> 
                    <span class="na">xsi:type=</span><span class="s">"xs:string"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>Belt

            <span class="nt">&lt;saml2:Attribute</span> 
                <span class="na">Name=</span><span class="s">"access"</span> 
                <span class="na">NameFormat=</span><span class="s">"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:unspecified"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;saml2:AttributeValue</span> 
                    <span class="na">xmlns:xs=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"</span> 
                    <span class="na">xmlns:xsi=</span><span class="s">"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;/saml2:AttributeValue&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;/saml2:Attribute&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;/saml2:AttributeStatement&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/saml2:Assertion&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/saml2p:Response&gt;</span>
</code></pre></div>
<p>(Identity provider initiated SSO)</p>

<h4 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h4>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://&lt;branded_sub_domain&gt;.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/sso/SAML2/Authenticate</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>SAMLResponse</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Encoded (base64) SAML2 Response message (<a href="#suported-saml-elements">see details</a>)</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>RelayState</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>URL the Service Provider should redirect to after successful sign-on</td>
<td>false</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>302</td>
<td>Relaying SSO authentication</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>403</td>
<td>SSO is disabled for this Account</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>501</td>
<td>SSO not active for this Account</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h4 id="suported-saml-elements">Suported SAML elements</h4>

<ul>
<li><strong>NameID</strong>: The element which holds user email.<br></li>
<li><strong>Issuer</strong>: Identity Provider identifier to match SAML response with an appropriate account.<br></li>
<li><strong>Conditions</strong>:  Additional conditions on the use of the assertion can be provided inside this element. Currently supported: <code class="prettyprint">NotBefore</code> and <code class="prettyprint">NotOnOrAfter</code>.</li>
</ul>

<h4 id="attribute-statement">Attribute Statement</h4>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Supported Attributes Names</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>firstName</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>User&rsquo;s first name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>lastName</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>USer&rsquo;s last name</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>SAML Signature</th>
<th>Requirements</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>Signature Algorithm</td>
<td>RSA-SHA1</td>
<td>The signing algorithm used to digitally sign the SAML assertion and response</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Digest Algorithm</td>
<td>SHA1</td>
<td>The digest algorithm used to digitally sign the SAML assertion and response</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Authentication context class</td>
<td>X.509 Certificate</td>
<td>Authentication restriction</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="single-log-out">Single Log Out</h3>

<h4 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h4>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/sso/SAML2/LogOut</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>identity_provider</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Name of the account&rsquo;s branded subdomain, which is linked with Identity Provider settings</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<aside class="warning">Deprecated, please use the above instead.</aside>

<p>This is done through the standard SAML2 (Security Assertion Markup Language) and as such the identity provider will setup their account with a <strong>brand_saml_publickey_ret</strong> and <strong>brand_saml_namedid_path</strong></p>

<ul>
<li><p>The <strong>brand_saml_publickey_cert</strong> is a x509 certificate that contains a public key with which Eagle Eye Networks can validate that an SSO message is valid and verify that it has not been altered.  The format of this certificate is PEM (ascii encoded base 64 surrounded by lines containing <strong>&lsquo;&mdash;&ndash;BEGIN CERTIFICATEâ€”â€”â€˜</strong> and <strong>&#39;â€”â€”END CERTIFICATEâ€”â€”&rsquo;</strong></p></li>
<li><p>The <strong>brand_saml_namedid_path</strong> is the xml xpath to the node that contains the email address of the user being logged in</p></li>
</ul>

<p>Once the identity provider&rsquo;s account has been registered for SSO, then the identity provider can validate their users and then make a single sign on request with the users email address and the return link
This 64 bit encrypted message will be extracted from the header to be decoded and verified using the saml public key
Then using the saml named ID path, the user&rsquo;s email will be extracted and an <code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key&#39;</code> will be provided for that user</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/sso <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/sso</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Account context switch successful</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>Account with the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;account_id&#39;</code> provided cannot be found</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="check-authentication-is-valid">Check Authentication is valid</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This call allows you to check if the current authentication is still valid.  This is helpful to use before making subsequent calls using existing authentication.</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/isauth <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-v</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/isauth</code></p>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>User authentication is valid</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

</code></pre></div>

    </span><span class="nl">"customer_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"1234"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Account Name"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"contact_city"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"default_camera_passwords"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"pwordpword"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"contact_phone"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"access_restriction"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="s2">"enable_mobile"</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"active_alert_mode"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"default"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"allowable_ip_address_range"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"contact_last_name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Dafoe"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"contact_utc_offset"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"camera_quantity"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"brand_subdomain"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"c000"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"password_management_rules"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"allowed_minimum_length"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"allowed_maximum_length"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">64</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"days_to_expire"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"exclude_username"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"minimum_length"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"maximum_length"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">126</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"required_numeric_char"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"required_special_char"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"reuse_number_limit"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"reuse_time_limit"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="account-attributes">Account (Attributes)</h3>

<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>

<td></td>

<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_phone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Phone number of primary contact for account</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_mobile_phone</td>

<td>Mobile phone number of primary contact for account</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>owner_account_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>ID of the parent account (defaults to the account of the creating user)</td>

<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>timezone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Timezone of the account (defaults to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Pacific&#39;</code>) <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Alaska&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Arizona&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Central&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Eastern&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Hawaii&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;America/Anchorage&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;UTC&#39;</code>, &hellip;</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>status</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Account status. This can only be edited by superusers and account superusers from the parent/owner account <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;active&#39;</code> - normal working state <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;inactive&#39;</code> - logins are not allowed <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;suspended&#39;</code> - effectively no longer operational <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;pending_validation&#39;</code> - default state after account creation (before the user has validated the account)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>utc_offset</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Signed integer offset in seconds of the timezone from UTC. Automatically generated based on the timezone field</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>access_restriction</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing access restrictions <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;enable_mobile&#39;</code> - has access to mobile clients <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;enable_ip_restrictions&#39;</code> - if present and if <code class="prettyprint">&#39;allowable_ip_address_range&#39;</code> has been specified, limits logins to the address ranges specified</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>allowable_ip_address_range</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Each entry in the array specifies one address range. Entries use the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/&#39;</code> format. For example, to limit access to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;192.168.123.0-192.168.123.255&#39;</code>, the entry would be <code class="prettyprint">&#39;192.168.123.0/24&#39;</code>. If no entries are present, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0.0.0.0/0&#39;</code> is implied</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>session_duration</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Session duration in minutes. Session duration of 0 means <em>stay logged in forever</em></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>holiday</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>This field is no longer being used <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>work_days</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>String of length 7. Each position in the string corresponds to a day of the week. Monday is position 0, Tuesday is position 1, etc. Each character in the string can have a value of 1 or 0. 1 means that this day is a work day</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>work_hours</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Two entries. Each entry containing a time expressed in local time. The first entry in the array is the work day start time. The second entry in the array is the stop time. Times are represented using a 24 hour clock and are formatted as HHMM <br><br>Example: 8AM would be 0800 and 5PM would be 1700</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>alert_mode</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing possible alert modes as defined for this account. Accepts an array of any number of strings of varying length. This controls what values are able to be chosen for the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_alert_mode&#39;</code> field</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>active_alert_mode</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>A string chosen from values in the account <code class="prettyprint">&#39;alert_mode&#39;</code> array. Must be blank or one of the values defined in the alert_mode array. This is used to determine when to send motion alert notifications (defined by camera settings in the device model). If a motion alert is defined with an alert mode from one of the strings in the account &lsquo;alert_mode&rsquo; array, then the notifications triggered from that motion alert will only be sent when the account <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_alert_mode&#39;</code> is also set to that same alert mode string defined for that motion alert</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>default_camera_passwords</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Comma-delimited string of default camera passwords</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_shares</td>
<td>array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;string</br>&nbsp;&nbsp;]</br>]</td>
<td>Array of arrays with each sub-array representing a camera to be shared to 1 or more recipients. First position is camera ID. The next positions are populated by one or multiple recipients. All recipients are comma-separated string values of <code class="prettyprint">&#39;email,account&#39;</code>, where the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;account&#39;</code> can be omitted (will be automatically populated if the email address is registered to an account in the system) <br><br>Example: <br><code class="prettyprint">[</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">[</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;12345678&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;joe@em.com,His account&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;joe2@dd.com,That account&#39;</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">]</code><br><code class="prettyprint">]</code> <br><br><small><b><em>Note:</em></b> <em>camera_shares</em> and <em>camera_share_perms</em> are co-dependent and need to be updated together</small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#account-camera_share_perms-camera_id">camera_share_perms</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object keyed with camera IDs representing all recipients per camera and all permissions per recipient  <br><br>Example: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;12345678&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">{</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;joe@em.com,His account&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">[</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;edit_motion_areas&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;ptz_live&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;edit_ptz_stations&#39;</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">]</code><br><code class="prettyprint">}</code> <br><br><small><b><em>Note:</em></b> <em>camera_shares</em> and <em>camera_share_perms</em> are co-dependent and need to be updated together</small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_revoke_admins</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether to revoke all admin permissions for the users in the account (1) or not (0). This field doesn&rsquo;t save anything on the account itself. It will revoke admin privileges of any admins in the account</td>

<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the account is active (1) or not (0)</td>

<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_inactive</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the account is inactive (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_suspended</td>
<td>int</td>

<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>product_edition</td>

<tr>

<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_custom_brand</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the account has branding enabled (1) or not (0)</td>

<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>brand_subdomain</td>
<td>string</td>

<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
