</tr>
<tr>
<td>brand_corp_url</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Corporate website url</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>brand_name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Branded company name</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>brand_saml_publickey_cert</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Public certificate which Eagle Eye Networks will use to decrypt the SAML for SSO</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>brand_saml_nameid_path</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>The path within the SAML xml to find the users email address</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_without_initial_user</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Indicates whether to create the new account without an initial user (1) or not (0) (defaults to 0) <br><br>An initial user with <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_account_superuser=1&#39;</code> will be created using the arguments <code class="prettyprint">&#39;contact_first_name/contact_last_name/contact_email&#39;</code> specified upon account creation</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>customer_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Arbitrary ID assigned to a sub-account by a master account</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_master_video_disabled_allowed</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether a sub-account can block video access to reseller (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_master_video_disabled</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether video access is blocked to reseller (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_contract_recording</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the account is of type contract_recording. Controls whether contract recording features are enabled for the users in this account on the front-end GUI (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_advanced_disabled</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the reseller has disabled advanced functionality (1) or not (0) If this is set for a sub-account, the users in the sub-account cannot change any settings related to bandwidth, billing (retention and resolution) and certain account settings. Master users switched in still can modify these things if their permissions allow it</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_billing_disabled</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the reseller has disabled editing settings in a sub-account that affect billing (1) or not (0). This controls whether users can change camera resolution/retention, add/delete cameras, etc</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_add_delete_disabled</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the reseller has disabled adding or deleting devices (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_disable_all_settings</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the reseller has disabled all device and most account settings (1) or not (0). Does not affect editing users, layouts, or sharing</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>first_responders</td>
<td>array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;string</br>&nbsp;&nbsp;]</br>]</td>
<td>Array of arrays with each sub-array representing an emergency responder. Accounts can identify a list of email accounts that will serve as emergency responders. Emergency responders get access to the identified <code class="prettyprint">&#39;responder_cameras&#39;</code> during an emergency (triggered by setting <code class="prettyprint">&#39;responder_active&#39;</code>). A responder is identified by their email, first name, last name, company and their account <br><br>Example: <br><code class="prettyprint">[</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">[</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;mark@responders.com&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;Mark&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;O&#39;Malley&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;Responders&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;Fake Account&#39;</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">]</code><br><code class="prettyprint">]</code></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>responder_active</td>
<td><p hidden>???</p></td>
<td>Indicates whether the responder cameras can be seen by the users defined under <code class="prettyprint">&#39;first_responders&#39;</code></td>

<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>responder_cameras</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of camera <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-ESN')">ESNs</a> that are shared to first responders</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>inactive_session_timeout</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Maximum time period in seconds without activity before web session expires</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>login_attempt_limit</td>
<td>int</td>

<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_rtsp_cameras_enabled</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the account can have cameras attached over RTSP (instead of ONVIF) (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>brand_support_phone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Branded support phone number</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>default_cluster</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Indicates the data center cluster the account is assigned to</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_system_notification_images_enabled</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether email notifications about online/offlice status should contain images from those cameras (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>map_lines</td>
<td>json</td>
<td>This is used by the front end to overlay lines over a map of the cameras for the account</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_two_factor_authentication_forced</td>
<td>int</td>

<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_utc_offset</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>This field is no longer being used <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>

<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#account-password_management_rules">password_management_rules</a></td>
<td>json</td>

<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong> (with feature flag)</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#account-idp_settings">idp_settings</a></td>
<td>json</td>

<h3 id="account-password_management_rules">Account - password_management_rules</h3>

<p>Parameters of password_management_rules object.
On password change by default users are disallow to set previous password.</p>

<p><strong>Length requirements</strong></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>minimum_length</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Minimum password length. This can be set if feature flag is On (Default value: 10)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>maximum_length</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Maximum password length. This is a constant value and it is equal to 126.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>allowed_minimum_length</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Bottom range of password minimum length. This is a constant value and it is equal to 10.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>allowed_maximum_length</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Upper range of password minimum length. This is a constant value and it is equal to 64.</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<aside class="notice">Following settings require feature flag. Conntact support to enable.</aside>

<p><strong>Character requirements</strong></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>required_numeric_char</td>
<td>int enum [0,1]</td>
<td>At password reset, the user will be required to create a password with at least one numeric character.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>required_special_char</td>
<td>int enum [0,1]</td>
<td>At password reset, the user will be required to create a password with at least one special character.</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p><strong>Reuse requirements</strong></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>reuse_number_limit</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>At password reset, the user will be required to create a password that was not previously used for the selected number of previous passwords of the given user.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>reuse_time_limit</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>At password reset, the user will be required to create a password that was not previously used for the selected number of days.</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p><strong>Other requirements</strong></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>days_to_expire</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>The user will be required to create a new password in the given number of days.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>exclude_username</td>
<td>int enum [0,1]</td>
<td>At password reset, the user will be required to create a password that does not contain a username of the given user.</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="account-idp_settings">Account - idp_settings</h3>

<p>Account&rsquo;s IdP (Identity Provider) settings.</p>

<aside class="notice">Following settings require feature flag. Conntact support to enable.</aside>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>JSON Property</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>is_enabled</td>
<td>boolean</td>
<td>Predicate, has the account enabled Authentication with Identity Provider?</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_subaccount_idp_allowed</td>
<td>boolean</td>
<td>Predicate, is the Authentication with Identity Provider allowed for sub-accounts? (Editable only at the level of the master account)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>issuer</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Identity Provider identifier to match SAML response with an appropriate account.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>sso_url</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Identity Provider URL to which send an Authentication request.</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p><strong>Notes on IdP settings in the context of the accounts hierarchy</strong><br>
There are three possible mutually exclusive modes of IdP configuration:</p>

<ol>
<li><p><strong>SSO is disabled for all accounts (master and its subs)</strong><br>
The standard login page is going to be loaded if an unauthenticated user requests EEN site.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>SSO enabled on the master account</strong><br>
All of the accounts (master and its subs) use the master account&rsquo;s IdP settings to SSO.  </p></li>
<li><p><strong>SSO allowed for the sub-accounts</strong><br>
Sub-accounts can have an individual set of settings for IdP to SSO. SSO to master account is disabled.</p></li>
</ol>

<p><strong>SSO Modes expressed with a master account idp_settings values</strong></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>SSO Modes</th>
<th><code class="prettyprint">is_enabled</code></th>
<th><code class="prettyprint">is_subaccount_idp_allowed</code></th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>1. disabled for all</td>
<td><code class="prettyprint">false</code></td>
<td><code class="prettyprint">false</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>2. enabled for all</td>
<td><code class="prettyprint">true</code></td>
<td><code class="prettyprint">false</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>3. enabled only for sub-accounts</td>
<td><code class="prettyprint">false</code></td>
<td><code class="prettyprint">true</code></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h2 id="get-account">Get Account</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns an Account object by ID</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[ACCOUNT_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account-ID')">Account ID</a></td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>403</td>
<td>Forbidden due to the user missing the necessary privileges</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>Account not found with the supplied ID</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h2 id="create-account">Create Account</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Create a new Account</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> PUT https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"name": "[NAME]", "contact_first_name": "[CONTACT_FIRST_NAME]", "contact_last_name": "[CONTACT_LAST_NAME]", "contact_email": "[CONTACT_EMAIL]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">PUT https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>name</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Name of the account</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>contact_first_name</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>First name of primary contact for account</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>contact_last_name</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Last name of primary contact for account</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>contact_email</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Email of primary contact for account</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_street</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing street addresses of the primary contact for account [<code class="prettyprint">&#39;address line 1&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;address line 2&#39;</code>]</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_city</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>City of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_state</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>State/province of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_postal_code</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Zip/postal code of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_country</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Country code of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>owner_account_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>ID of the parent account (defaults to the account of the creating user)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>timezone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Timezone of the account (defaults to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Pacific&#39;</code>) <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Alaska&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Arizona&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Central&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Eastern&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Hawaii&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;America/Anchorage&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;UTC&#39;</code>, &hellip;</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>status</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Account status. This can only be edited by superusers and account superusers from the parent/owner account <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;active&#39;</code> - normal working state <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;inactive&#39;</code> - logins are not allowed <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;suspended&#39;</code> - effectively no longer operational <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;pending_validation&#39;</code> - default state after account creation (before the user has validated the account)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>access_restriction</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing access restrictions <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;enable_mobile&#39;</code> - has access to mobile clients <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;enable_ip_restrictions&#39;</code> - if present and if <code class="prettyprint">&#39;allowable_ip_address_range&#39;</code> has been specified, limits logins to the address ranges specified</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>allowable_ip_address_range</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Each entry in the array specifies one address range. Entries use the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/&#39;</code> format. For example, to limit access to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;192.168.123.0-192.168.123.255&#39;</code>, the entry would be <code class="prettyprint">&#39;192.168.123.0/24&#39;</code>. If no entries are present, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0.0.0.0/0&#39;</code> is implied</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>session_duration</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Session duration in minutes. Session duration of 0 means <em>stay logged in forever</em></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>holiday</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>This field is no longer being used <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>work_days</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>String of length 7. Each position in the string corresponds to a day of the week. Monday is position 0, Tuesday is position 1, etc. Each character in the string can have a value of 1 or 0. 1 means that this day is a work day</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>work_hours</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Two entries. Each entry containing a time expressed in local time. The first entry in the array is the work day start time. The second entry in the array is the stop time. Times are represented using a 24 hour clock and are formatted as HHMM <br><br>Example: 8AM would be 0800 and 5PM would be 1700</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>alert_mode</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing possible alert modes as defined for this account. Accepts an array of any number of strings of varying length. This controls what values are able to be chosen for the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_alert_mode field&#39;</code></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>active_alert_mode</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>A string chosen from values in the account <code class="prettyprint">&#39;alert_mode&#39;</code> array. Must be blank or one of the values defined in the alert_mode array. This is used to determine when to send motion alert notifications (defined by camera settings in the device model). If a motion alert is defined with an alert mode from one of the strings in the account &lsquo;alert_mode&rsquo; array, then the notifications triggered from that motion alert will only be sent when the account <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_alert_mode&#39;</code> is also set to that same alert mode string defined for that motion alert</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>default_camera_passwords</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Comma-delimited string of default camera passwords</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_without_initial_user</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether to create the new account without an initial user (1) or not (0) (defaults to 0) <br><br>An initial user with <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_account_superuser=1&#39;</code> will be created using the arguments <code class="prettyprint">&#39;contact_first_name/contact_last_name/contact_email&#39;</code> specified upon account creation</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_initial_user_not_admin</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the initial user is an admin (0) or not (1)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#account-password_management_rules">password_management_rules</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>JSON object representing settings for Users passwords.</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#account-idp_settings">idp_settings</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>JSON object representing Identity Provider settinngs.</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

    </span><span class="nl">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"1234abcd"</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">

<h2 id="update-account">Update Account</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Update Account information</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"id": "[ACCOUNT_ID]", "contact_first_name": "[CONTACT_FIRST_NAME]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account-ID')">Account ID</a> generated during creation</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Name of the account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_first_name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>First name of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_last_name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Last name of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_email</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Email of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_street</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing street addresses of the primary contact for account [<code class="prettyprint">&#39;address line 1&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;address line 2&#39;</code>]</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_city</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>City of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_state</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>State/province of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_postal_code</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Zip/postal code of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_country</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Country code of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_phone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Phone number of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>contact_mobile_phone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Mobile phone number of primary contact for account</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>timezone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Timezone of the account (defaults to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Pacific&#39;</code>) <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Alaska&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Arizona&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Central&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Eastern&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Hawaii&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;America/Anchorage&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;UTC&#39;</code>, &hellip;</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>status</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Account status. This can only be edited by superusers and account superusers from the parent/owner account <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;active&#39;</code> - normal working state <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;inactive&#39;</code> - logins are not allowed <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;suspended&#39;</code> - effectively no longer operational <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;pending_validation&#39;</code> - default state after account creation (before the user has validated the account)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>access_restriction</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing access restrictions <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;enable_mobile&#39;</code> - has access to mobile clients <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;enable_ip_restrictions&#39;</code> - if present and if <code class="prettyprint">&#39;allowable_ip_address_range&#39;</code> has been specified, limits logins to the address ranges specified</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>allowable_ip_address_range</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Each entry in the array specifies one address range. Entries use the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/&#39;</code> format. For example, to limit access to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;192.168.123.0-192.168.123.255&#39;</code>, the entry would be <code class="prettyprint">&#39;192.168.123.0/24&#39;</code>. If no entries are present, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0.0.0.0/0&#39;</code> is implied</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>session_duration</td>
<td>int</td>

<td>holiday</td>
<td>array[string]</td>

<td>work_days</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>String of length 7. Each position in the string corresponds to a day of the week. Monday is position 0, Tuesday is position 1, etc. Each character in the string can have a value of 1 or 0. 1 means that this day is a work day</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>work_hours</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Two entries. Each entry containing a time expressed in local time. The first entry in the array is the work day start time. The second entry in the array is the stop time. Times are represented using a 24 hour clock and are formatted as HHMM <br><br>Example: 8AM would be 0800 and 5PM would be 1700</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>alert_mode</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing possible alert modes as defined for this account. Accepts an array of any number of strings of varying length. This controls what values are able to be chosen for the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_alert_mode field&#39;</code></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>active_alert_mode</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>A string chosen from values in the account <code class="prettyprint">&#39;alert_mode&#39;</code> array. Must be blank or one of the values defined in the alert_mode array. This is used to determine when to send motion alert notifications (defined by camera settings in the device model). If a motion alert is defined with an alert mode from one of the strings in the account <code class="prettyprint">&#39;alert_mode&#39;</code> array, then the notifications triggered from that motion alert will only be sent when the account <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_alert_mode&#39;</code> is also set to that same alert mode string defined for that motion alert</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>default_camera_passwords</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Comma-delimited string of default camera passwords</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_shares</td>
<td>array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;string</br>&nbsp;&nbsp;]</br>]</td>
<td>Array of arrays with each sub-array representing a camera to be shared to 1 or more recipients. First position of the sub-array is action, with <code class="prettyprint">&#39;M&#39;</code> for add/modify or <code class="prettyprint">&#39;D&#39;</code> for delete. Second position is camera ID. The next positions are populated by one or multiple recipients. All recipients are comma-separated string values of <code class="prettyprint">&#39;email,account&#39;</code>, where the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;account&#39;</code> can be omitted (will be automatically populated if the email address is registered to an account in the system). Recipients are only present in the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;M&#39;</code> action <br><br>Example: <br><code class="prettyprint">[</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">[</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;M&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;12345678&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;joe@em.com,His account&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;joe2@dd.com,That account&#39;</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">]</code><br><code class="prettyprint">]</code> <br><br><small><b><em>Note:</em></b> <em>camera_shares</em> and <em>camera_share_perms</em> are co-dependent and need to be updated together</small></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#account-camera_share_perms-camera_id">camera_share_perms</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object keyed with camera IDs representing all recipients per camera and all permissions per recipient  <br><br>Example: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;12345678&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">{</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;joe@em.com,His account&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">[</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;edit_motion_areas&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;ptz_live&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;edit_ptz_stations&#39;</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">]</code><br><code class="prettyprint">}</code> <br><br><small><b><em>Note:</em></b> <em>camera_shares</em> and <em>camera_share_perms</em> are co-dependent and need to be updated together</small></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>

Master users switched in still can modify these things if their permissions allow it</td>

Emergency responders get access to the identified <code class="prettyprint">&#39;responder_cameras&#39;</code> during an emergency (triggered by setting <code class="prettyprint">&#39;responder_active&#39;</code>). A responder is identified by their email, first name, last name, company and their account <br><br>Example: <br><code class="prettyprint">[</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">[</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;mark@responders.com&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;Mark&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;O&#39;Malley&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;Responders&#39;</code>,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">&#39;Fake Account&#39;</code><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">]</code><br><code class="prettyprint">]</code></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>

<h2 id="account-statistics">Account Statistics</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This service allows to retrieve Statistics about a specific <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account')">Account</a> or all <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Sub-Account')">Sub-Accounts</a> (for a <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Master-Account')">Master Account</a>)</p>

<p>Obtains the total amount of:</p>

<ul>
<li><a href="#total-number-of-sub-accounts">Sub-Accounts</a></li>
<li><a href="#total-number-of-users">Users</a></li>
<li><a href="#total-number-of-bridges">Bridges</a></li>
<li><a href="#total-number-of-cameras">Cameras</a></li>
<li><a href="#total-number-of-online-users">Online Users</a></li>
<li><a href="#total-number-of-online-cameras">Online Cameras</a></li>
</ul>

<p>Each statistics request extends the <code class="prettyprint">/g/account</code> endpoint in the following way <code class="prettyprint">/g/account/statistics/&lt;type_of_statistic&gt;</code></p>

<h3 id="total-number-of-sub-accounts">Total Number of Sub-Accounts</h3>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Used to get the number of all sub-accounts for the specific account</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account/statistics/sub_accounts <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"account_id=[ACCOUNT_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account/statistics/sub_accounts</code></p>

<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>

<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account-ID')">Account ID</a> for which the statistics will be returned (defaults to the account of the user)</td>
<td>false</td>

</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">

          <h1 id="user">User</h1>

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<h3 id="user-attributes">User (Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Editable</th>
<th>Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-User-ID')">User ID</a> automatically generated and assigned during creation</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#update-user"><button>POST</button></form></sub></strong> <br><strong><sub><form action="#delete-user"><button>DELETE</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>first_name</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>First name of the user</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#create-user"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>last_name</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Last name of the user</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#create-user"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>email</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Email address of the user (must contain only ASCII characters) <br><br> For TFA: address to which messages containing TFA code will be delivered</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#create-user"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>uid</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Identifier of the user <small><strong>(INTERNAL USE ONLY)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>phone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Phone number</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>mobile_phone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Mobile phone number</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>street</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings containing street addresses [<code class="prettyprint">&#39;address line 1&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;address line 2&#39;</code>]</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>city</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>City</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>state</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>State/province</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>country</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Two letter country code</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>postal_code</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Zip/postal code</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>owner_account_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Unique identifier of the account that the user belongs to</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>active_account_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Unique identifier of the user&rsquo;s active account. When switching to a sub-account the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_account_id&#39;</code> of that user in their session becomes the unique identifier of the sub-account that was switched into</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>user_pin</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Six digit string that signifies a support pin</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_staff</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the user is a staff member (1) or not (0) <small><strong>(INTERNAL USE ONLY)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_superuser</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the user is a superuser (1) or not (0). Only superusers can set this <small><strong>(INTERNAL USE ONLY)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_account_superuser</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the user is an account superuser (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_active</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the user is active (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_pending</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the user is pending (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_master</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the user is in a master account (1) or not (0)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_user_admin</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>This is for backwards compatibility <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>

When an event triggers a motion alert within a motion box set to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;High&#39;</code>, all users with notify levels <code class="prettyprint">&#39;High&#39;</code> will be notified of the occurrence</td>

<h2 id="permissions">Permissions</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h3 id="user-types">User Types</h3>

<ul>
<li><strong><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Superuser')">Superuser</a></strong> <small><strong>(INTERNAL USE ONLY)</strong></small></li>
<li><strong>Staff</strong> <small><strong>(INTERNAL USE ONLY)</strong></small></li>
<li><strong><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account-Superuser')">Account Superuser</a></strong></li>
<li><strong>Regular User</strong></li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Account superuser</strong></p>

<p>The account superuser has a full set of permissions. This user can manage all users in their account and sub-account</p>

<aside class="notice">An indicator of the administrator status is the flag &lsquo;is_account_superuser&rsquo;</aside>

<p><strong>Regular user</strong></p>

<p>After being created the regular user has several default permissions : <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_live_video&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_recorded_video&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_export_video&#39;</code></p>

<h3 id="list-of-permissions">List of Permissions</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Required Parameter</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>is_superuser</td>
<td><small><strong>(INTERNAL USE ONLY)</strong></small></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_staff</td>
<td><small><strong>(INTERNAL USE ONLY)</strong></small></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_account_superuser</td>
<td>Highest permission level possible for a user. All permissions are enabled (including the view permission)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_account</td>
<td>View and edit all account settings (including categories: Control, Days, Security, Camera, Alerts, Notifications, Privacy, Sharing, Responders, and Retention). Ability to create new sub-accounts and access any sub-accounts created</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_camera_on_off</td>
<td>Ability to turn cameras on and off. If this is the only camera permission granted all others are hidden</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_cameras</td>
<td>Allows editing all camera settings (does not allow adding or deleting cameras). View previews is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_motion_areas</td>
<td>Enables the <em>Motion</em> tab under camera settings. View previews and view recorded video is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_ptz_stations</td>
<td>Enables the <em>PTZ</em> tab under camera settings. Set PTZ mode and add/edit/delete stations. View previews is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_sharing</td>
<td>Enables the <em>Sharing</em> and <em>Responders</em> tabs under Account Settings (This setting is not required if <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_edit_account&#39;</code> is enabled)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_users</td>
<td>Enables the management of non-administrator users in a sub-account (add/delete/modify users). Gives the ability to grant access to cameras and layouts</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_export_video</td>
<td>Enables to download preview and full resolution video. View previews is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_all_and_add</td>
<td>Enables the management of bridges and cameras (add/edit/delete). Refers to devices only. View previews is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_camera_less_billing</td>
<td>Allows editing all camera settings except retention and full video resolution (no ability to add/delete). View Previews is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_layout_admin</td>
<td>Enables the management of layouts (any user can create/edit/delete their own layouts. User layouts are always visible to admin users)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_user_create_layout</td>
<td>Enables creation of layouts.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_map</td>
<td>Ability to add and edit floors, lines and shapes on the map.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_live_video</td>
<td>Allows viewing full resolution video live from cameras. View previews is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_ptz_live</td>
<td>Enables the control over pan, tilt, zoom and recall stations while viewing preview or live video of PTZ cameras. View previews is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_recorded_video</td>
<td>View history browser and archived video from cameras. View previews is enabled automatically with this permission</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_view_preview_video</td>
<td>Enables the preview of images from cameras</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_admin_users</td>
<td>Enables the management of all users in a sub-account (add/delete/modify all users including administrators. Only available to Master Users). Also allows to create new sub-accounts and access any sub-accounts created. (Only available to Master Users.)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_edit_all_users</td>
<td>Enables the management of master users who are not administrators (add/delete/modify master account users) <br><br>Ability to grant access to sub-accounts. No user permissions are granted in sub-accounts. Only available to master account users</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_device_admin</td>
<td>This is for backwards compatibility <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_user_admin</td>
<td>This is for backwards compatibility <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p>The table below shows which user management actions a user can execute depending on the account they belong to and which permission flags they have enabled</p>

<table style="margin-top:30px;">
  <tr>
    <td style="background-color:transparent;" rowspan="3" colspan="3" ></td>
    <th colspan="4" style="text-align:center; border:solid 1px;background-color:#F3F7FA;">Who I am</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;border:solid 1px;background-color:#F3F7FA;">In Master Account</td>
    <th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;border:solid 1px;background-color:#F3F7FA;">In Child Account</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>

<h3 id="tfa-enforcing">TFA Enforcing</h3>

<p>The following entities can edit the Two-Factor Authentication settings for an account:</p>

<ul>
<li>The <strong>Superuser</strong> is able to force TFA for:

<ul>
<li>Any <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Sub-Account')">Sub-Account</a> from within the <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Master-Account')">Master Account</a></li>
<li>The Sub-Account they have currently switched into</li>
</ul></li>
<li>The <strong>Account Superuser</strong> is able to force TFA for:

<ul>
<li>The Sub Account in which they have been granted administrator permissions</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="get-user">Get User</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns a User object by ID</p>

<aside class="notice">If no unique identifier is passed in the request, then the response will return data of the current user</aside>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/user <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[USER_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/user</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-User-ID')">User ID</a></td>
<td>false</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>403</td>
<td>Forbidden due to the user missing the necessary privileges</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>No user matching the unique identifier was found</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h2 id="create-user">Create User</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Create a new User. After being created the user is in the pending state (<code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_pending=1&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_active=0&#39;</code>). The user creation email will be sent to the email address passed in the request. Then the user will be able to enter a password (In this step they may need to accept <a href="#terms-of-service">Terms of Service</a>). After this operation the user will be active (<code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_pending=0&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_active=1&#39;</code>)</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> PUT https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/user <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"first_name": "[FIRST_NAME]", "last_name": "[LAST_NAME]", "email": "[EMAIL]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<td>string</td>
<td>Timezone of the user. Defaults to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Pacific&#39;</code> <br><br>Possible values: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Alaska&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Arizona&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Central&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Eastern&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Hawaii&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;America/Anchorage&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;UTC&#39;</code>, &hellip;</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>alternate_email</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Alternate email address</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>sms_phone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Phone number to be used for Two Factor authentication code delivery when SMS method is selected</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_sms_include_picture</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>DEPRECATED</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#user-json">json</a></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Miscellaneous settings of the user as a Json-formatted string</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_access</td>
<td>array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;string</br>&nbsp;&nbsp;]</br>]</td>
<td>This is for backwards compatibility <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>is_notify_enable</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether notifications are enabled for the user (1) or not (0)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>notify_period</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Time periods during which the user will receive alert notifications. Each element of the array contains three fields separated by dashes. The first field is the day of the week where Monday is 0. The second element is the start time. The third element is the end time. If empty, user will not receive any alert notifications <br><br>All times are expressed in local time and use a 24 hour clock formatted as HHMM</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>notify_rule</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Alert notification rules. Each rule contains three fields separated by dashes in the form of: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;alert_label&gt;-&lt;notification_method&gt;-&lt;delay&gt;&#39;</code> <br><br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;alert_label&gt;&#39;</code> - name defined by the user <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;notification_method&gt;&#39;</code> - either <code class="prettyprint">&#39;email&#39;</code>, or <code class="prettyprint">&#39;gui&#39;</code> <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;delay&gt;&#39;</code> - amount of time in minutes between notifications</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>access_period</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Contains the time periods during which the user has access to the account. Each element of the array contains three field separated by dashes. The first field is the day of the week where Monday is 0. The second element is the start time. The third element is the end time. If empty, user has no time restrictions for access to the account. All times are expressed in local time and use a 24 hour clock formatted as HHMM</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

          <h1 id="bridge">Bridge</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>The <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Bridge')">Bridge</a> is a product of Eagle Eye that is deployed at the customer location and communicates with industry standard cameras. It converts the cameras to be compatible with the <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-EEVB')">EEVB</a> and record <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Asset')">Assets</a>. The Bridge is configured and controlled via a cloud-based user interface (has no built-in user interface). The Bridge may serve local assets directly to local clients. The Bridge will also store assets until they are transferred to the EEVB. The Bridge can be configured via DHCP or have a static IP address</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h3 id="bridge-attributes">Bridge (Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Editable</th>
<th>Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Bridge-ID')">Bridge ID</a> automatically generated and assigned while adding the device to the <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-EEVB')">EEVB</a></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#get-bridge"><button>GET</button></form></sub></strong> <br><strong><sub><form action="#update-bridge"><button>POST</button></form></sub></strong> <br><strong><sub><form action="#delete-bridge"><button>DELETE</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>name</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Name of the bridge</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#add-bridge-to-eevb"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#bridge-settings">settings</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of basic settings (location, etc.)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_settings_status_code</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether it was possible to retrieve the device settings (200) or not (404) <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_settings</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Miscellaneous device settings <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>utcOffset</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Signed UTC offset in seconds of the set <code class="prettyprint">&#39;timezone&#39;</code></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>timezone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Indicates the timezone of where the device is installed (defaults to the account timezone) <br><br>Example: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Alaska&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Arizona&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Central&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Eastern&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Hawaii&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;America/Anchorage&#39;</code> or <code class="prettyprint">&#39;UTC&#39;</code></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>guid</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>The GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) is an immutable device identifier assigned to a device during the production process</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>permissions</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>String of characters each defining a permission level of the current user</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>tags</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings each representing a tag name</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#camera-bridges">bridges</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of bridges (<a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-ESN')">ESNs</a>) this device is seen by <small><strong>(APPLIES ONLY TO CAMERAS)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_parameters_status_code</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether it was possible to retrieve parameters of the device (200) or not (404)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_parameters</td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of bridge parameters. If bridge parameters cannot be retrieved for whatever reason (example: communication with the bridge has been lost), this will be empty and camera_parameters_status_code will be 404</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_info_status_code</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether it was possible to retrieve information about the device (200) or not (404)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#bridge-camera_info">camera_info</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of basic bridge information. If bridge information cannot be retrieved for whatever reason (example: communication with the bridge has been lost), this will be empty and camera_info_status_code will be 404</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="bridge-settings">Bridge - settings</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>latitude</td>
<td>float</td>
<td>Latitude of the bridge location</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>longitude</td>
<td>float</td>
<td>Longitude of the bridge location</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>street_address</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Street address of the bridge location</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>site_name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>User-defined bridge location name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>floor</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>The floor of the building given that it is a multi-storey</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>retention_days</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Total amount of days the bridge should store data. Data exceeding this threshold will gradually be deleted</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>local_retention_days</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Total amount of days the bridge should store data locally. Normally data is not being stored and the value is set to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;-1&#39;</code>, meaning the bridge should directly upload any and all data during the specified times. Data exceeding this threshold will gradually be deleted</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>local_display_layout_ids</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>An array of available layouts on a local display</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>analog_inputs_ignored</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>An array of numbers of analog inputs which the user wants to ignore</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<aside class="success">The listed settings are most common examples because the model differs from device to device</aside>

<aside class="notice">local_retention_days and cloud_retention_days are unpurposed in CMVR mode</aside>

<h2 id="get-bridge">Get Bridge</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns a Bridge object by ID</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/device <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[BRIDGE_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/device</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Bridge-ID')">Bridge ID</a></td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>403</td>
<td>Forbidden due to the user missing the necessary privileges</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>No device matching the Connect ID or GUID has been found</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="add-bridge-to-eevb">Add Bridge to <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-EEVB')">EEVB</a></h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Adds a Bridge to the Eagle Eye Video Bank</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> PUT https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/device <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"name":"[NAME]","connectID":[CONNECT_ID]}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span><span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<td>video_status</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Indicates the video status of the camera: <small><strong>(APPLIES TO ANALOG CAMERAS)</strong></small> <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;0x00000000&#39;</code> - signal ok <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;0x00000102&#39;</code> - no signal</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>20</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>array</td>
<td>Location of the device specified in the following way: <br><br><code class="prettyprint">[</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">latitude(float),</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">longitude(float),</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">azimuth(float/null for bridge),</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">range(int/null for bridge),</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">street address(string),</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">floor(int),</code> <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<code class="prettyprint">location name(string)</code> <br><code class="prettyprint">]</code> <br><br>Note: If any field is not set, the value is null</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>21</td>
<td>parent_camera_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Parent camera ID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>22</td>
<td>child_camera_view</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Child camera view</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>23</td>
<td>is_hidden</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>GUI control to not show device</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>24</td>
<td>ignored_inputs</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of analog port numbers which should be ignored by the bridge</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>25</td>
<td>responder_camera</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether the camera is a first responder camera (1) or not (0)</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

          <h1 id="managed-switch">Managed Switch</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>To simplify <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera')">Camera</a> troubleshooting Eagle Eye Networks provides managed Ethernet switches to be integrated into camera LAN. The managed switch uses PoE (Power over Ethernet) to provide power to cameras connected to its LAN ports the same way a typical PoE switch would, but it can additionally switch the power in individual ports on or off in response to commands delivered via Eagle Eye Network API (Thus forcing a camera <em>hard reset</em> by simply cycling its power supply)</p>

<aside class="notice">Managed Switches can only be controlled or listed from within the account, where the device resides</aside>

<p>For each reference in this section to port being &lsquo;on&rsquo;, &lsquo;off&rsquo;, &lsquo;enabled&rsquo; or &lsquo;disabled&rsquo;, <strong>only the PoE power delivery function is meant</strong>. Communication function of the ports is not affected by this API</p>

<p>Manged Switches may be standalone or built into EEN bridges (e.g. model 305)</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="get-managed-switch">Get Managed Switch</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns a Managed Switch object by GUID</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/managed_switch <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"switch_guid=[SWITCH_GUID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/managed_switch</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>switch_guid</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-GUID')">GUID</a> of the managed switch</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bridge_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Bridge-ID')">Bridge ID</a> of the connected or integrated bridge</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>

<tr>

<h2 id="control-managed-switch">Control Managed Switch</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This API call enables control of the Managed Switch (i.e. for turning ports on or off)</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/managed_switch/control <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"switch_guid": "[SWITCH_GUID]", "ports": ["port_1", "port_2"], "command": "reboot"}'</span>  <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/managed_switch/control</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>switch_guid</strong></td>
<td>string</td>

<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>command</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Control commands: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;enable&#39;</code> - turn port on <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;disable&#39;</code> - turn port off <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;reboot&#39;</code> - cycle ports&rsquo; power</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>ports</strong></td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Ports to be affected by the command</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<blockquote>
<p>Json Response</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Success"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">

<h2 id="control-camera-power">Control Camera Power</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This API call enables control of camera power using the camera identifier rather than port number of the switch</p>

<blockquote>
