          <h1 id="camera">Camera</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>The <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Device')">Device</a> service allows access to create new logical devices (<a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera')">Cameras</a> or <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Bridge')">Bridges</a>) and establish a relationship between logical and <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Physical-Camera')">physical devices</a>. The GET method is available to any user with Camera <code class="prettyprint">&#39;R&#39;</code> (Read) permission. Methods POST, DELETE are available to account superusers and users with Camera <code class="prettyprint">&#39;W&#39;</code> (Write) permissions for the indicated camera. PUT method is only available to account superusers</p>

<p>When adding a new Camera, the name and settings parameters are required. The settings parameter should contain the ID of the bridge and the GUID of the Camera</p>

<h3 id="camera-settings-overview">Camera Settings Overview</h3>

<p>The camera setting system is based on an inheritance model. User settings are <em>overlaid</em> on top of default settings for a device. By removing the user settings, the camera setting will automatically go back to the default value provided and maintained by Eagle Eye for the camera</p>

<p>Under the covers this works as follows:</p>

<ul>
<li>There is a default setting, range and value for everything built into the code, guaranteeing there are always settings for any feature supported by the software. These values are defined when the feature is implemented in software</li>
<li>There is an optional <em>global</em> setting file that can/will be distributed during patches/updates that can override and extend default settings including changing valid ranges, etc. As with 1, this is a constant across all bridges that get the upgrade. It is tweaked for system policy changes like different upload bandwidth, default schedules, etc. which do not imply code changes</li>
<li>There is an optional per make/model/version file, part of the make/model/version driver deployment, that can add and adjust settings for anything above. This is used to optimize things like sensitivity or codec parameters while building the driver for the specific device and is released a camera driver is updated. This is also where camera specific features (audio availability) is announced</li>
<li>The first three get merged to produce the base settings for the the camera, which defines the value, min and max for every supported feature</li>
<li>User settings (things the user has consciously <em>taken control of</em>) are dynamically overlaid on the above settings inheritance to produce the active settings on the camera</li>
<li>Any scheduled or triggered changes are then overlaid on top create the running settings (so upload bandwidth can be changed in a schedule to something different from the users settings, which is also different from the system default and when the schedule is <em>removed</em> the bandwidth will go back to the user value</li>
</ul>

<p>The implication of this is that if a user has not <em>pinned</em> a setting by changing/managing it, it will track any system or make/model/version release updates. That is, EEN can optimize operating parameters and they will automatically propagate unless the user has changed/pinned them. Further, the user should be <em>aware</em> of this, which works well with an open/closed control metaphor or a check box - any setting control that is open/checked is <em>manually</em> set by the user, whereas closed controls will track EEN system wide recommendations. Finally, it is expected that the <em>user</em> settings will be managed to be only the value specifically modified by users, not all settings</p>

<p>The set of all settings is potentially large and far more than most users will ever want or need to manage. A separate table will be maintained which lists the <em>normal</em> settings - settings most users may want to interact with. This is standard across all devices and contains a list of settings names that should be accessible to the user. This list should be <em>joined</em> with the list of all settings to result in a subset of controls to be displayed in basic mode. An advanced mode should make all settings available with primitive controls to set or delete a value</p>

<p>An implication of this model the <em>user settings</em> object is a generic object that is only lightly interpreted by the device. Settings that match a known names (i.e. are within the camera base or mmv settings) will be utilized, but all values will be stored and returned as part of the <em>user settings</em> field. This can be used to support user interface elements on a per camera basis with values the bridge/camera do not interpret</p>

<h3 id="read-camera-settings-get-device-camera_settings-property">Read Camera Settings (<small>GET device <code class="prettyprint">&#39;camera_settings&#39;</code> property</small>)</h3>

<p>When getting the camera settings, a Json string representing a Json object is returned containing:</p>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_settings&#39;</code> - A set of named entities encapsulating all settings understood for this device. Each entity contains an object of:

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;v&#39;</code> - the current value of the setting, as influenced by filters on top of base settings</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;max&#39;</code> - the maximum allowed value</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;min&#39;</code> - the minimum allowed value</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;d&#39;</code> - the default value of the setting, also defining the expected type for the field</li>
<li>Note: max and min are applicable for numeric fields. for set fields (e.g. preview_resolution) the min field will contain an array of the valid values</li>
<li>Note: additional descriptive members may be added to this object over time, implementation must ignore fields they do not understand</li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_filters&#39;</code> - an array of filters currently being applied. List is in priority order, that is earlier entries will override later entries in the list. Each entry is a string with format of one of:

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;schedule_&lt;name&gt;&#39;</code> - name replaced by schedule name</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;user_user&#39;</code> - constant, indicating where user settings are applied</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;trigger_&lt;name&gt;&#39;</code> - name replaced by the triggered name (i.e. <code class="prettyprint">&#39;night&#39;</code>)</li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;user_settings&#39;</code> - an object with the following fields:

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;settings&#39;</code>

<ul>
<li>A subset of the base settings, indicating items the user has specifically set</li>
<li>The user settings contain only the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;v&#39;</code> of the setting and are bare objects (e.g. <code class="prettyprint">&#39;contrast=0.1&#39;</code>)</li>
<li>Most setting are <code class="prettyprint">&#39;atomic&#39;</code> entities updated at a single time. For value settings (brightness) this is obvious, but for complex settings (e.g. <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Alert-Notification')">Alerts</a>) it is important the entire setting object is replaced with a new value</li>
<li>A few settings (currently <code class="prettyprint">&#39;alerts&#39;</code>,<code class="prettyprint">&#39;rois&#39;</code>,<code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_alerts&#39;</code>,<code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_rois&#39;</code>) are accumulation settings. A setting add transaction adds the new member to the set and a settings delete removes a member</li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;schedules&#39;</code> - A set of named fields as follows:

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;start&#39;</code> - time object, indicating when the schedule is set to on. This is a transition point in time, not a description of the active time period. To have a schedule that runs during working hours - { <code class="prettyprint">&#39;start&#39;</code>: { <code class="prettyprint">&#39;hours&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">8</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;wdays&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">[1,2,3,4,5]</code>}, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;end&#39;</code>: {<code class="prettyprint">&#39;hours&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">17</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;wdays&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">[1,2,3,4,5]</code> }}</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;end&#39;</code> - time object, indicating when the schedule is removed</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;priority&#39;</code> - a floating point value defining the priority of the schedule. Lowest number wins. All user settings are applied with priority of 10.0, so schedule values with priority &lt; 10 will override user settings, while value &gt; 10 will not. It priority or two schedules is equal and their settings conflict,</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;settings&#39;</code> - a object with members mirroring the settings above, indicating the new value for settings to use while the schedule is active. For accumulation settings, values will be added into the set when activated and removed when deactivated</li>
</ul></li>
<li>time object is a object with the following named members, loosely patterned after crontab arguments. Each time the fields match the current time, the event is toggled

<ul>
<li>fields

<ul>
<li>seconds(0-59)(defaults to 0)</li>
<li>minutes (0-59) (defaults to 0)</li>
<li>hours (0-23) (defaults to 0)</li>
<li>mdays(1-31) (defaults to *)</li>
<li>wdays(1-7) (1=Monday, 7=Sunday (defaults to nothing))</li>
<li>months(1-12) (defaults to *)</li>
</ul></li>
<li>each field can be

<ul>
<li>single integer</li>
<li>string <code class="prettyprint">&#39;*&#39;</code> indicating all</li>
<li>list of integers</li>
</ul></li>
<li>If both <code class="prettyprint">&#39;days&#39;</code> fields are set, the action will be ran on the union</li>
</ul></li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h3 id="update-camera-settings-post-device-camera_settings_add-argument">Update Camera Settings (<small>POST device <code class="prettyprint">&#39;camera_settings_add&#39;</code> argument</small>)</h3>

<p>To update/set settings (i.e. override default setting value with a <em>user</em> setting), a Json string is sent representing a Json object containing:</p>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;settings&#39;</code> - an optional object with members to be overlaid over base settings value. Values are bare (that is simply replacements for the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;v&#39;</code> field of base)</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;schedules&#39;</code> - an optional object with 1 or more members, each a schedule object per the get description. Note schedules with the same name will be replaced in the their entirety with the new value</li>
</ul>

<h3 id="delete-camera-settings-post-device-camera_settings_delete-argument">Delete Camera Settings (<small>POST device <code class="prettyprint">&#39;camera_settings_delete&#39;</code> argument</small>)</h3>

<p>To delete/unset settings (i.e. return to default setting value), a Json string is sent representing a Json object containing:</p>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;settings&#39;</code> - an optional object with members to be removed from user settings. Values ignored</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;schedules&#39;</code> - an optional object with 1 or more members, each a the name of a current schedule. Value of the members are ignored</li>
</ul>

<h3 id="camera-settings-currently-supported">Camera Settings (<small>Currently Supported</small>)</h3>

<p>Each camera make/model/version is different, thus not every setting is supported for some cameras, but here is list of core camera settings that are relevant to most applications:</p>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_rois&#39;</code> - object indicating which rois are currently active (by <code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;roiname&gt;&#39;</code>, see <code class="prettyprint">&#39;rois&#39;</code> setting below)</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;audio_enable&#39;</code> - boolean (true/false) indicating whether audio is enabled or not</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;camera_on&#39;</code> - boolean integer (1/0) indicating whether camera is turned on/off respectively</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_sensitivity&#39;</code> - float between 0 and 1 indicating how sensitive the motion detection is</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_size_ratio&#39;</code> - float between 0 and 1 indicating the size of objects to detect for motion</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_boxes_metric_active&#39;</code> - boolean integer indicating whether motion boxes are enabled</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;preview_realtime_bandwidth&#39;</code> - float indicating the max bandwidth of real-time preview image transmission</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;preview_transmit_mode&#39;</code> - string indicating when preview images are transmitted to the cloud</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;preview_interval_ms&#39;</code> - integer indicating how many milliseconds between preview images</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;preview_resolution&#39;</code> - string indicating the resolution of the preview images. When displaying the options for this setting, you must use the data from <code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_config.v.preview_quality_settings.&lt;preview_resolution&gt;&#39;</code> (<code class="prettyprint">&#39;w&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;h&#39;</code>) to show what this resolution string translates to for display purposes</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;preview_quality&#39;</code> - string indicating the quality of the preview images</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;retention_days&#39;</code> - integer indicating how many days worth of data should be retained in the cloud</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;rois&#39;</code> - extensible object, containing multiple ROI objects keyed by a <code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;roiname&gt;&#39;</code>, with each ROI object supporting the following members:

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;verts&#39;</code> - [[<code class="prettyprint">&#39;x&#39;</code>,<code class="prettyprint">&#39;y&#39;</code>], &hellip;], polygon vertices in order. Coordinates will be scaled so <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0-1.0&#39;</code> is full screen for <code class="prettyprint">&#39;x&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;y&#39;</code>, with <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0,0&#39;</code> being top left corner. Edges canâ€™t cross or bad things will happen</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_noise_filter&#39;</code> - as for main screen. If &lt; 0.001 will not be applied</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_sensitivity&#39;</code> - as for main screen. If &lt; 0.001 will not be applied</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_hold_interval&#39;</code> - as for main screen. If &lt; 0.001 will not be applied</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;priority&#39;</code> - float (bigger wins), control settings overlay (defaults to 0.0)</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_threshold&#39;</code> - (float)percentage of the screen to be occluded by motion within this ROI to create an ROI event (defaults to motion_size_ratio from main screen)</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;name&#39;</code> - string used for the display name of the ROI in a GUI. Not to be confused with the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;roiname&gt;&#39;</code> as the key of this ROI object</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;ignore_motion&#39;</code> - boolean integer (1/0) indicating whether motion will be ignored for this ROI. Used as a GUI abstraction to indicate we want to set <code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_sensitivity&#39;</code> to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0.001&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion_noise_filter&#39;</code> to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0.99&#39;</code></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;roiid&#39;</code> - (int)id to attach to the ROI event. If 0 or not present, events will not be created, which will also prevent ROI-based alerts</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;hold_off_ms&#39;</code> - (int) ms of constant motion before an event is created, defaults to motion_event_holdoff_ms</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;hold_on_ms&#39;</code> - (int) ms of idle before stopping an ROI motion event (defaults to motion_event_holdon_ms from main settings)</li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;scene_type&#39;</code> - string indicating the type of scene the camera is viewing</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_transmit_mode&#39;</code> - string indicating when video is transmitted to the cloud</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_capture_mode&#39;</code> - string indicating when video will being recorded</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_bandwidth_factor&#39;</code> - integer indicating the bit rate of the video. When displaying options for this setting, you must use the data from <code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_config.v.video_quality_settings.&lt;video_resolution&gt;.quality.&lt;video_quality&gt;.kbps&#39;</code> to show what this setting translates to for display purposes</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_resolution&#39;</code> - string indicating the resolution of the video. When displaying the options for this setting, you must use the data from <code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_config.v.video_quality_settings.&lt;video_resolution&gt;&#39;</code> (<code class="prettyprint">&#39;w&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;h&#39;</code>) to show what this resolution string translates to</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_quality&#39;</code> - string indicating the quality of the video</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_config&#39;</code> - read-only object defining all the preview/video configuration parameters for each available resolution. Helps give useful information for display purposes of the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;preview_resolution&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_resolution&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;video_bandwidth_factor&#39;</code> settings/options</li>
</ul>

<h3 id="regions-of-interest-rois">Regions of Interest (<small>ROIs</small>)</h3>

<p>ROIs will be defined by simple polygons - sequences of x,y coordinates that form a closed object, edge crosses are illegal and will have bizarre results. Each ROI will describe a portion of the screen. ROIs can overlap and priority (higher wins) determines what sensitivity settings to use. For overlapping ROIs, all will get motion block detection and can trigger ROI motion spans</p>

<p>ROIs can:</p>

<ul>
<li>Adjust DCT sensitivity and detection properties (ignore stuff in an area, track stuff aggressively in an area)</li>
<li>Cause specific events</li>
<li>Characterize an object for later alert/event processing (dwell, transitions counting)</li>
<li>Turn on certain detectors within a region</li>
</ul>

<p>ROIs within settings will be <code class="prettyprint">&#39;rois&#39;</code>: { <code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;roiname&gt;&#39;</code>: { <code class="prettyprint">&#39;roiid&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">1437974150</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;name&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;Rusty Region&#39;</code>, &hellip; }. ROIs are enabled and disabled by <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_rois&#39;</code>: { <code class="prettyprint">&#39;&lt;roiname&gt;&#39;</code>: <code class="prettyprint">true</code>, &hellip; } to allow ROIs to easily be turned on and off to support schedules and ROI based alerts. To remove an active ROI delete it with the same arguments</p>

<p>Like the alert logic, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;rois&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_rois&#39;</code> are accumulation settings - adding an object adds it to the holding object instead of replacing the entire object like most settings. Similarly, deleting an object removes it from the parent object, but leaves the parent in place. Both also automatically trigger updates to the active <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-ESN')">ESN</a> data streams</p>

<p>ROIs can produce events and force video recording on activity within them. These events are distinct from motion events (whole screen events). Each ROI event has a simple snapshot algorithm the grabs a snapshot immediately, as opposed to the optimized object tracking for motion events. Since ROIs are presumed to be smaller, this should result in good summary images</p>

<p>ROI <a href="#event-objects">events</a> are reported by the ROMS and ROME etags:</p>

<p>ROMS</p>

<ul>
<li>cameraid <small>(guint32)</small> - ID of the device this event was reported by</li>
<li>eventid <small>(guint32)</small> - ID unique to this event</li>
<li>roiid <small>(guint32)</small> - ROI ID from the ROI definition</li>
<li>videoid <small>(guint32)</small> - ID of the associated video</li>
</ul>

<p>ROME</p>

<ul>
<li>cameraid <small>(guint32)</small> - ID of the device this event was reported by</li>
<li>eventid <small>(guint32)</small> - ID unique to this event</li>
</ul>

<h3 id="camera-attributes">Camera (Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Editable</th>
<th>Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a> automatically generated and assigned while adding the camera to a <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Bridge')">Bridge</a></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#get-camera"><button>GET</button></form></sub></strong> <br><strong><sub><form action="#update-camera"><button>POST</button></form></sub></strong> <br><strong><sub><form action="#delete-camera"><button>DELETE</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>name</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Device name</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#add-camera-to-bridge"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong><a href="#camera-settings">settings</a></strong></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of basic settings (location, motion regions, etc.)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#add-camera-to-bridge"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_settings_status_code</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether it was possible to retrieve the device settings (200) or not (404) <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_settings</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Miscellaneous device settings <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>utcOffset</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Signed UTC offset in seconds of the set <code class="prettyprint">&#39;timezone&#39;</code> (defaults to the camerasâ€™s bridge offset)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>timezone</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Indicates the timezone of the camera (defaults to the camerasâ€™s bridge timezone) <br><br>Example: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Alaska&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Arizona&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Central&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Eastern&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;US/Hawaii&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;America/Anchorage&#39;</code> or <code class="prettyprint">&#39;UTC&#39;</code></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>guid</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>The GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) is an immutable device identifier assigned to a device during the production process</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>permissions</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>String of characters each defining a permission level of the current user <br><br>Permissions include: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;R&#39;</code> - user has access to view images and video for this camera <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;W&#39;</code> - user can modify and delete this camera <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;S&#39;</code> - user can share this camera in a group share</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>tags</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of strings each representing a tag name</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#camera-bridges">bridges</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of bridges (<a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-ESN')">ESNs</a>) this device is seen by and the camera attach status: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;ATTD&#39;</code> - the camera is attached to a bridge <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;IGND&#39;</code> - the camera is unattached and is available to be attached</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_parameters_status_code</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether it was possible to retrieve the device parameters (200) or not (404)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_parameters</td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of camera parameters. If camera parameters cannot be retrieved for whatever reason (example: communication with the bridge has been lost), this will be empty and camera_parameters_status_code will be 404</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_info_status_code</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Indicates whether it was possible to retrieve information about the device (200) or not (404)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#camera-camera_info">camera_info</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of basic information related to a camera. If camera information cannot be retrieved for whatever reason (example: communication with camera has been lost), then this will be empty and camera_info_status_code will be 404</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<aside class="notice">All cameras in a group must have the â€˜Sâ€™ permission or the group cannot be shared</aside>

<h2 id="get-camera">Get Camera</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns a Camera object by ID</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/device <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[CAMERA_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/device</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a></td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>403</td>
<td>Forbidden due to the user missing the necessary privileges</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="get-cameras-rtsp-urls">Get Camera&rsquo;s RTSP URLs</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns the full RTSP URLs for a Camera object by ID.</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/device/rtsp <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[CAMERA_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<h2 id="add-camera-to-bridge">Add Camera to <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Bridge')">Bridge</a></h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Adds an unattached Camera to the bridge</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>

<h2 id="get-list-of-cameras">Get List of Cameras</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns an array of arrays with each sub-array representing a Camera available to the user. The <code class="prettyprint">&#39;service_status&#39;</code> attribute is set either to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;ATTD&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;IGND&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;IDLE&#39;</code> or <code class="prettyprint">&#39;ERSE&#39;</code>. If the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;service_status&#39;</code> is <code class="prettyprint">&#39;ATTD&#39;</code>, the camera is attached to a bridge. If the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;service_status&#39;</code> is <code class="prettyprint">&#39;IGND&#39;</code>, the camera is unattached from any bridge and is available to be attached. If the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;service_status&#39;</code> is <code class="prettyprint">&#39;IDLE&#39;</code>, the camera will register but will not operate (unregistered bridges). The <code class="prettyprint">&#39;ERSE&#39;</code> status is used to erase all camera data from the bridge</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">--request</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/device/list <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

          <h1 id="action">Action</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This service defines several macro actions that can be attached to <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Device')">Devices</a>. These are convenience functions. The same functionality provided herein can also be accomplished via individual setting calls. Most actions can be scheduled to occur now or at some point in the future</p>

<p>Given the macro nature and the number of devices and operations that may occur, as long as the arguments are correct, the service will return success status code regardless of the result on each individual device. The application should monitor the vent stream to determine success or failure of the action on a device to device basis</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="turn-cameras-on">Turn Cameras On</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Used to turn on cameras with given ids&rsquo; <strong>OR</strong> given bridge id  in the userâ€™s account. User must be an account superuser. Has no effect on body worn cameras.</p>

<p>Request</p>

          <h1 id="images-and-video">Images and Video</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Asset')">Asset</a> services provide access to Media Assets - previews and video in appropriate formats. Asset services are used in conjunction with list transactions to enumerate and identify Assets. All assets are tagged with and can be identified by the EEN Timestamp</p>

<h3 id="een-timestamp">EEN Timestamp</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>EEN Timestamp</strong></td>
<td><strong>Format:</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;YYYYMMDDhhmmss.xxx <small>(string)</small> <br><strong>System:</strong>&nbsp;Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) <br><small>Synchronized time zone: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT)</small> <br><br><strong>Example:</strong>&nbsp;<em>Jan 2, 2018 08:30:20.00</em> == <em>20180102083020.000</em></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="assets-identifiers">Assets Identifiers</h3>

<ul>
<li><strong><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Timestamp')">Timestamp</a>:</strong> Eagle Eye timestamps have the format YYYYMMDDhhmmss.xxx and are always specified in GMT time. In most contexts special tokens can also be used to specify relative times - <code class="prettyprint">&#39;now&#39;</code> is the current time (a value starting with + or - is an offset from the current time, +/- offsets from <code class="prettyprint">&#39;now&#39;</code> are valid in milliseconds)</li>
<li><strong><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a>:</strong> Cameras are identified by a 8 character hexadecimal string, representing a unique 32 bit ID associated with a specific camera (Camera ID are not necessarily linked to specific hardware devices to allow device upgrade and replacement without disruption of history storage)</li>
<li><strong>Format:</strong> Images are always returned as <strong>JPEG</strong> images. Video can currently be returned as either <strong>FLV</strong> format (playback in browsers via Flash) or <strong>MP4</strong> (download and export format)</li>
</ul>

<h3 id="retrieve-image">Retrieve Image</h3>

<p>The image request model provides an efficient mechanism for accessing image sequences for several usage models. Image requests can be done directly using the next/after/prev virtual model. This returns images before or after specified timestamps. Alternatively, the timestamp and event information can be fetched through the <a href="#get-list-of-images">List</a> interface (to get <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Event')">Events</a> for history) and <a href="#poll">Poll</a> interface to track new images as they become available in real-time. The following description provides typical usage models for various events:</p>

<ul>
<li><strong>Low bandwidth video playback:</strong> The preview stream is a sequential set of JPEG images. If played back in order, low resolution video is accomplished

<ul>
<li>The simplest implementation is to fetch <code class="prettyprint">&#39;next&#39;</code> with a timestamp of <code class="prettyprint">&#39;now&#39;</code> (i.e. <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/asset/next/image.jpeg?timestamp=now&amp;id=12345678&amp;asset_class=pre&#39;</code>) - waiting for the subsequent image after the current time. Each time an image is returned, a new request should be made. If the downstream bandwidth is very low, the image fetch will automatically slow down (because delivery of image A happens after image B has been received, so the next call will fetch image C, skipping display of image B entirely). This approach works well for tracking a single image stream (Tip: the first request should be done as a <code class="prettyprint">&#39;prev&#39;</code> request to make sure an image is displayed, before the sequential next requests). The downside of this model is it requires a dedicated socket for each image stream being played. Many browsers have a limited pool of open sockets</li>
<li>A more efficient mechanism for tracking multiple image streams is to use the <a href="#poll">Poll</a> interface. It will provide the timestamp of the next image available for a set of camera, which can then be fetched via the /asset/asset call. Since the poll request supports multiple cameras in a single request, it requires only a single socket for any number of cameras. The client application should implement a <em>fair</em> algorithm across the returned timestamps to address low bandwidth situations (that is, make sure every image stream gets updated before you fetch a new image for the same stream). This algorithm will provide smooth frame rate degradation across any number of cameras, whether the performance bottleneck is client CPU or bandwidth. The best model for this is:

<ul>
<li>Receive update <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Alert-Notification')">Notifications</a> for all cameras being tracked via a single sequential poll session</li>
<li>For each camera, keep track of the latest image notification, replacing the last one even if it has not been fetched yet</li>
<li>With a limited pool of <em>requests</em> do a fair rotation between all cameras, fetching only the most recent image for each and skipping the fetch if the image is already loading</li>
</ul></li>
</ul></li>
<li><strong>Random access image discovery:</strong> The preview and thumb image streams can provide a visual navigation tool for accessing recorded video. The typical implementation requires a map from a timestamp to the <em>best</em> image for that timestamp. To implement this approach, the client should use the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;after&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;prev&#39;</code> requests with the timestamp of the user playhead. Both calls provide header data for x-ee-timestamp, x-ee-next and x-ee-prev which identify the current and subsequent images in both directions when it can be easily determined. The usage paradigm for this should be:

<ul>
<li>On navigation event (large jump), determine the timestamp of the user playhead and do an <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/asset/prev&#39;</code> call to get the appropriate image. Store the x-ee-timestamp, x-ee-next and x-ee-prev values for the image</li>
<li>As the user moves the playhead, if the time change is within the next/prev halfway bounds, no new request is required. When the user moves outside of the time range, do an image fetch with the new timestamp</li>
</ul></li>
<li><strong>Thumbnail navigation:</strong> The system provides a <em>thumbnail</em> image for each event which is intended to provide a small representation of the event. The easiest mechanism to get a thumbnail for an event is to do an <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/asset/after/image.jpeg?asset_class=thumb...&#39;</code> image request with the starting timestamp of the event</li>
</ul>

<h3 id="image-formats">Image Formats</h3>

<ul>
<li><strong>JPEG:</strong> Native format for the system. Images are always returned as JPEG images</li>
</ul>

<h3 id="retrieve-list-of-images">Retrieve List of Images</h3>

<p>There are numerous different ways to get a list of images:</p>

<p>Get all preview images between April 1st and April 2nd<br>
<code class="prettyprint">https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/list/image.jpeg?id=100676b2&amp;start_timestamp=20180401000000.000&amp;end_timestamp=20180402000000.000&amp;asset_class=all</code></p>

<p>Get 500 images before April 1st<br>
<code class="prettyprint">https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/list/image.jpeg?id=100676b2&amp;start_timestamp=20180401000000.000&amp;count=-500&amp;asset_class=all</code></p>

<p>Get the next 500 images after April 1st<br>
<code class="prettyprint">https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/list/image.jpeg?id=100676b2&amp;start_timestamp=20180401000000.000&amp;count=500&amp;asset_class=all</code></p>

<h3 id="retrieve-video">Retrieve Video</h3>

<p>Video is accessed via the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;play&#39;</code> command. Video is captured in segments and is limited to 5 minutes per segment in storage. The video command will seamlessly rewrite headers within the video format to join segments as necessary to deliver the requested data span. However, we highly encourage developers to fetch only 5 minutes at a time to ensure that users aren&rsquo;t filling storage on their bridge needlessly</p>

<p>If the end time of the segment is in the future, the video will follow the data stream as it arrives, delivering live video streaming with minimal latency (if the camera is not streaming video, the video will stop (and start again) as video is captured, which is typically not what is desired). MP4 format cannot be live streamed</p>

<p>The keyword <code class="prettyprint">&#39;stream_&lt;streamid&gt;&#39;</code> can be used for the starting timestamp. This forces the camera to capture video and stream it to the cloud live. The stream ID should be globally unique(ish) string - combination of a timestamp and user ID works well</p>

<p>The start timestamp must match the starting timestamp of a video if the video already exists. Subsegments of a video span can be specified by using the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;time_offset&#39;</code> argument. For example assume a 5 minute video has been recorded from 12:30 to 12:35. The query <code class="prettyprint">&#39;?start_timestamp=20181120123000.000&amp;end_timestamp=20181120123400.000&amp;time_offset=180000&amp;...&#39;</code> will play one minute of video (timestamped at 12:33), 3 minutes into the video starting at 12:30, clipping off the last minute of the recorded segment</p>

<aside class="notice">Time offsets and end timestamps can be set to any time, but the system will seek to the nearest key frame to start the video</aside>

<aside class="warning">Important note on performace</aside>

<p>API calls can initially be done against <code class="prettyprint">&#39;https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com&#39;</code> (The host url), but after the authorization response is returned, API calls should then use the <strong>branded subdomain</strong>. At this stage the branded host url will become <code class="prettyprint">&#39;https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com&#39;</code>, where the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_brand_subdomain&#39;</code> field is returned in the authorization response</p>

<p>Each account will consistently have the same <em>branded subdomain</em> and as such will not change throughout the life of the session. Caching the subdomain is safe as long as the client software validates against the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active_brand_subdomain&#39;</code> after authorization. Using the <em>branded subdomain</em> is important for speed and robustness</p>

<h3 id="video-formats">Video Formats</h3>

<p>The video system is based on H264 video and AAC audio. These streams are encapsulated in different formats for compatibility with different playback modes</p>

<ul>
<li><strong>FLV:</strong> Native format for the system. Playable in any Flash player, VLC as well as other players</li>
<li><strong>MP4:</strong> MPEG4 files have a very broad playback compatibility (in line with all the major video players), however <em>MP4 is NOT a streamable format</em>, so it is only used for download functionality and will return an error if the video is live</li>
<li><strong>RTSP:</strong> The protocol is used for live-streaming. By this format you can get live stream of a camera.</li>
</ul>

<!-- Placed before "### Video Quality" after the last file format description
    <aside class="warning">While streaming any video format on the web other than FLV (system native format), you may initially get a 502 response</aside>

    This means that the video is currently being transcoded within our system and therefore couldn&rsquo;t be found. Assuming the data actually exists (check against the video list call), the video will eventually be ready for you to fetch in the desired format, but for the time being, you will have to wait and refetch until the requested video is ready &ndash;>

<h2 id="get-image">Get Image</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Get a JPEG image based on the specified timestamp. This will return binary image data in JPEG format</p>

<h3 id="cache-control-headers-to-allow-asset-caching-if-not-now-relative">Cache control headers to allow asset caching if not <code class="prettyprint">&#39;now&#39;</code>-relative:</h3>

<h3 id="play-streams">Play streams</h3>

<p>These streams are valid for 15 minutes. You can use them to get a live stream on camera in RTSP format. Now you can use a player that support RTSP like <code class="prettyprint">ffplay</code> to start live-streaming. For example: <code class="prettyprint">ffplay [stream url]</code>
if you are going to use <code class="prettyprint">rtsp_over_http</code> stream url, first you need do some setting in <code class="prettyprint">VLC</code>. Please go to <code class="prettyprint">Tools &gt; Preferences &gt; Input/Codecs &gt; Demuxers &gt; RTP/RTSP</code> in <code class="prettyprint">VLC</code> and select option <code class="prettyprint">Tunnel RTSP and RTP over HTTP</code> and set <code class="prettyprint">HTTP tunnel port</code> as <code class="prettyprint">31180</code>.
Now use <code class="prettyprint">RTSP</code> stream url one to start live-streaming in <code class="prettyprint">VLC</code>. In this case <code class="prettyprint">VLC</code> will create an HTTP tunnel to send RTSP commands.</p>

<h2 id="prefetch-video">Prefetch Video</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<aside class="warning">This API call is currently being updated and may change.  Please reach out to api_support@een.com with any problems.</aside>

<aside class="notice">
  <p>
    This API calls must use the **branded subdomain**. The branded host url will become `&lsquo;https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com&rsquo;`, where the `&lsquo;active_brand_subdomain&rsquo;` field is returned in the authorization response
  </p>
  <p>
    Each account will consistently have the same *branded subdomain* and as such will not change throughout the life of the session. Caching the subdomain is safe as long as the client software validates against the `&lsquo;active_brand_subdomain&rsquo;` after authorization. Using the *branded subdomain* is required for this endpoint.
  </p>
</aside>

<p>This API call will ensure the video is in the cloud. If the video is not in the cloud it will do a background upload request to the bridge to acquire the video into the cloud. A webhook provided with the call will be triggered when the upload is successful or an error has occurred. The webhook will be triggered as a POST with Json-formatted data.</p>

<p>In the event the video was successfully retrieve by the cloud, the <code class="prettyprint">success_hook</code> will be called.  If there was a failure, the optional <code class="prettyprint">failure_hook</code> will be called.  The request will try to retrieve the video for 24 hours before giving up and calling <code class="prettyprint">failure_hook</code>.</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/cloud/video.flv <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[CAMERA_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"start_timestamp=[START_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"end_timestamp=[END_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"success_hook=[WEBHOOK_URL]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"failure_hook=[WEBHOOK_URL]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/cloud/video.flv</code></p>

<h2 id="get-list-of-images">Get List of Images</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Get a list of objects, where each object contains the type of event delivering the image and timestamp</p>

<aside class="notice">When formatting the request, either the &lsquo;end_timestamp&rsquo; or &lsquo;count&rsquo; parameter is required</aside>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/list/image <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[CAMERA_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"start_timestamp=[START_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"end_timestamp=[END_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"asset_class=[ASSET_CLASS]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h2 id="get-list-of-videos">Get List of Videos</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Get a list of objects, where each object contains the ID, start and end timestamp of a single video clip</p>

<aside class="notice">When formatting the request, either the `&lsquo;end_timestamp&rsquo;` or `&lsquo;count&rsquo;` parameter is required</aside>

<p>If the option <code class="prettyprint">&#39;options=coalesce&#39;</code> has been added, the videos with overlapping start and end timestamps with the previous or next video will be merged into one single video (one single object)</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/list/video <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[CAMERA_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"start_timestamp=[START_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"end_timestamp=[END_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"options=coalesce"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a></td>
<td>true</td>

<tr>

<h2 id="get-snapshot-of-recording">Get Snapshot of recording</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Get a full resolution jpeg image at the specified timestamp, from a recording. Returns binary image data at
the timestamp either equal to, or the closest point before, the requested timestamp. The closest
timestamp is a function of the configured GOP for the camera and the frame rate. The resolution of the image
returned is the full resolution of camera.</p>

<p>Snapshots are only available where there is video recorded from the camera. <code class="prettyprint">Get List of Videos</code>
can be used to identify when video has be recorded.</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request (jpeg)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/api/v2/media/<span class="o">{</span>camera_id<span class="o">}</span>/Snapshot?timestamp<span class="o">={</span>timestamp<span class="o">}</span>
 <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/api/v2/media/{camera_id}/Snapshot?timestamp={timestamp}</code>
<br> Get the image at, or closest image before, the specified timestamp.</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>camera_id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a></td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>timestamp</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Image timestamp in EEN format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.NNN</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<blockquote>
<p>Response (jpeg)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>JPEG&lt;file_content&gt;
</code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-response">HTTP Response</h3>

<p>The returned response can be binary data in JPEG format with status code 200, or a json error message.</p>

    </span><span class="nl">"data"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>

</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>

</blockquote>

          <h1 id="poll">Poll</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>The Poll service provides a mechanism for an application to receive <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Alert-Notification')">Notifications</a> of <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Event')">Events</a> or spans from Eagle Eye Networks. These entities are grouped by resource</p>

<aside class="success">This service will continually be extended</aside>

<h3 id="resources">Resources</h3>

<ul>
<li>pre - Timestamp for a preview image. The timestamp can later be used to retrieve the actual preview image</li>
<li>thumb - Timestamp for a thumbnail image. The timestamp can later be used to retrieve the actual thumbnail image</li>
<li>video - Start and end timestamp of a video event</li>
<li><a href="#status-bitmask">status</a> - Bitmask defining the state of a bridge or a camera</li>
<li><a href="#status-bitmask">status64</a> - Bitmask extended status bitmask</li>
<li><a href="#status-bitmask">status_hex</a> - Hex version of bitmask for easier reading (websocket only)</li>
<li><a href="#status-bitmask">status_hex64</a> - Hex version of extended status (websocket only)</li>
<li><a href="#event-objects">event</a> - Full event information</li>
</ul>

<p>Poll is a stateful request for updates any time a matching event occurs within the service. The initial Poll request is a POST (Default GET with <a href="#websocket-polling">WebSocket</a>) with a Json-formatted body indicating the resources to track. Resources that are video, pre and thumbnail automatically register the API caller to their respective events. However, resource type <code class="prettyprint">&#39;event&#39;</code> requires the API caller to tell the API what events to listen for</p>

<p>Each object consists of an ID element and a list of resource types to be monitored. The POST transaction receives and immediately responds with a Json-formatted body indicating the current timestamp for all requested resources. The response also includes a cookie, which can be used to track changes to the indicated resources via GET transaction</p>

<h3 id="event-sources">Event Sources</h3>

<ul>
<li><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Device')">Device</a> - camera alerts, start and stop recording, etc.</li>
<li>System - maintenance, server changes, etc.</li>
<li><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account')">Account</a> - other user changes, account alerts, layout changes, etc.</li>
</ul>

<p>Camera and device events include: on, off, online, offline, currently recording, currently sensing motion, start/stop schedule event, being controlled with PTZ, etc.</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="event-objects">Event Objects</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<blockquote>
<p>Event Objects</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"status_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">200</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"message"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"OK"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"data"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"100e1e23"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"event"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"PRSS"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">

                    </span><span class="nl">"timestamp"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"20180425100000.000"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                    </span><span class="nl">"cameraid"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"10087ff5"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                    </span><span class="nl">"flags"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                    </span><span class="nl">"duration"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3600000</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                    </span><span class="nl">"previewid"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1493114470</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">

    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">

<aside class="notice">Each event type is returned with the EEN formatted timestamp: YYYYMMDDhhmmss.xxx</aside>

<aside class="notice">id fields are encoded internally as uint32 values.  However, using the event object, they are encoded in int32 format.  Fields this apply to include videoid, eventid, roiid, alertroid, alertid, and alert motionid</aside>

<h2 id="status-bitmask">Status Bitmask</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This status Bitmask is used to determine what the high-level/overall device status is</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HEX Value</th>
<th>Status</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>0x100000</td>
<td>Camera registered (internet online)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x020000</td>
<td>Camera on (user setting)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x080000</td>
<td>Camera recording (video stream is being recorded)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000010</td>
<td>Camera sending previews</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x040000</td>
<td>Camera streaming (camera is talking to bridge)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000020</td>
<td>Camera located (bridge has found the camera)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000080</td>
<td>Camera configuration in process (bridge configuring camera)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000100</td>
<td>Camera needs ONVIF password</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000200</td>
<td>Camera available but not yet attached</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000040</td>
<td>Camera not supported</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000800</td>
<td>Camera error</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x010000</td>
<td>Invalid state (unknown state)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000400</td>
<td><em>Internal status</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x001000</td>
<td><em>Internal status</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x002000</td>
<td><em>Internal status</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x004000</td>
<td><em>Reserved</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x008000</td>
<td><em>Reserved</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000001</td>
<td><small>Camera online <br><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000004</td>
<td><small>Camera on (user setting) <br><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000008</td>
<td><small>Camera recording <br><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x000002</td>
<td><small>Stream attached (camera communicating with bridge) <br><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p>The extended status bits are filtered and processed to provide more stable and faster event updates than legacy status bits.  As a result, they may reflect different status in some transition cases and extended bits should be considered authoritative.  Lower order 32 bits are per legacy status definition above.</p>

<p>NOTE: in the legacy status, if &ldquo;camera off&rdquo; (camera on false), the registered bit was suppressed.  In the extended bits, the registered bit always reflects the current bridge to cloud connection status.
NOTE: the extended status bits have a much shorter status filter, so will change to not registered/not streaming significantly faster than legacy status bits</p>

<h3 id="extended-status-bits-upper-32-bits-of-status64-et-al">Extended status bits (upper 32 bits of status64 et. al.)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HEX Value</th>
<th>Status</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>0x00000001</td>
<td>Camera Valid</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x00000002</td>
<td>Camera on (user setting)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x00000004</td>
<td>Camera registered (internet online)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x00000008</td>
<td>Camera pending/error (configuration issue prevents streaming)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>0x00000010</td>
<td>Camera streaming (camera is talking to bridge)</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="overall-status">Overall status</h3>

<p>IF 0 THEN &ldquo;No Change&rdquo;
<br>ELSE IF &ldquo;Camera On&rdquo; (<strong>bit 17</strong>)==0 THEN &ldquo;Off&rdquo; (orange forbidden icon)
<br>ELSE IF &ldquo;Registered&rdquo; (<strong>bit 20</strong>)==0 THEN &ldquo;Internet Offline&rdquo; (red exclamation icon)
<br>ELSE IF &ldquo;Streaming&rdquo; (<strong>bit 18</strong>)==1 THEN &ldquo;Online&rdquo; (green check icon)
<br>ELSE IF &ldquo;Password&rdquo; (<strong>bit 8</strong>)==1 THEN &ldquo;Password Needed&rdquo; (effectively &ldquo;Offline&rdquo;) (red padlock icon)
<br>ELSE &ldquo;Offline&rdquo; (red X icon)</p>

<h3 id="recording-status">Recording status</h3>

<p>IF &ldquo;Recording&rdquo; (<strong>bit 19</strong>) THEN Recording (green circle icon)
IF &ldquo;Invalid&rdquo; (<strong>bit 16</strong>)==1 THEN no status change (use whatever status bits were set previously)</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="initialize-poll">Initialize Poll</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<aside class="notice">Subscribe to the poll service, which is required for GET /poll. Response: token=xxxxx / Response headers: set_cookie: ee-poll-ses/poll_id=xxxxx</aside>

<p>Response includes 2 session cookies and a returned token (which are identical). Only one of the session cookies has to be provided to the GET /poll request</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/poll <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"cameras":{"[ID]":{"resource":["event","pre"],"event":["VREE","PRFR","CPRG"]}}}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s1">'Content-Type: application/json'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-v</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>

<p>Request Json</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"cameras"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"100e1e23"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"resource"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"pre"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"thumb"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"status"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"event"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"event"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
              </span><span class="s2">"MRBX"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"10097d15"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"resource"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"pre"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"thumb"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"status"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"event"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"event"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
              </span><span class="s2">"MRBX"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/poll</code></p>

<h3 id="resource-types">Resource Types</h3>

<p>Each resource type has a specific object format in response:</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Response</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>pre</td>
<td>prets</td>
<td>Timestamp of latest preview image</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>thumb</td>
<td>thumbts</td>
<td>Timestamp of latest thumbnail image</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>video</td>
<td>[startts, endts]</td>
<td>List of start and end timestamps for a video segment. Updates at start and per key frame received until end</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#status-bitmask">status</a></td>
<td>bitmask</td>
<td>A numerical bitmask defining the status. Bit position defines status</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#status-bitmask">status64</a></td>
<td>bitmask</td>
<td>A numerical bitmask defining the status. Bit position defines status</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#status-bitmask">status_hex</a></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>A string hexadecimal version of status (ws only)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#status-bitmask">status_hex64</a></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>A string hexadecimal version of status (ws only)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#event-objects">event</a></td>
<td>object</td>
<td>Events are a key value pair, where the key is the Four CC of the event and event structure is the actual meta data for that specific event</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<aside class="notice">The cameras parameter is an entity, which can contain any object structure keyed by ID (camera, bridge or account <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-ESN')">ESN</a>)</aside>

<p>Due to the progressing expansion of the event polling mechanic, the parameter <code class="prettyprint">&#39;cameras&#39;</code> has undergone numerous changes and has been kept as such for backwards compatibility. It should be understood as device/account</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>cameras</td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json attribute keyed with the <a href="#object-structure">&lt;object_id&gt;</a> (can contain multiple Json objects, even of different types)</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="object-structure">Object Structure</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>&lt;object_id&gt;</td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json attribute keyed with <code class="prettyprint">&#39;resource&#39;</code> and/or <code class="prettyprint">&#39;event&#39;</code></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p>The Json object allows to narrow down the polling scope by specifying which type of entity to poll for. The types include:</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>resource</strong></td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of one or more string containing which type of data should be retrieved from the provided device/account<br><br>enum: pre, thumb, video, status, event</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>event</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of one or more string containing the event <a href="#event-objects">Four CC</a> (if resource contains <code class="prettyprint">&#39;event&#39;</code>, the array of events specified here will narrow down the scope of retrieved events)</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<!--TODO: Find out why the video as a feasible resource has been excluded from the above table-->

<aside class="warning">The event parameter is required to have the event resource present when polling over HTTP (instead of WebSocket)</aside>

<blockquote>
<p>Json Response</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"cameras"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"100e1e23"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1441847</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"10097d15"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1441847</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"token"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"ooe0eoEAMNsF"</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-response-json-attributes">HTTP Response (Json Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>cameras</td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json attribute keyed with the <a href="#response-object-structure">&lt;object_id&gt;</a> (can contain multiple Json objects, even of different types)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>token</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Token to be used for subsequent GET /poll requests</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="response-object-structure">Response Object Structure</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>&lt;object_id&gt;</td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json attribute keyed with <a href="#poll">resource</a> types. Retrieved values are the most recent entities for the specified resource</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<p>The amount of keys depends on the sent request inquiry (if the request entailed <code class="prettyprint">&#39;pre&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;video&#39;</code>, then the retrieved data will only cover <code class="prettyprint">&#39;pre&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;video&#39;</code> information)</p>

<p>If a specified event has not been triggered on the device/account, it will not be listed by the poll service (no error will be reported)</p>

<aside class="warning">The status parameter takes precedence (if multiple) and all others will become suppressed when polling over HTTP POST /poll</aside>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>403</td>

</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h2 id="polling">Polling</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<aside class="notice">Used to receive updates on real-time changes. This API call requires a valid &lsquo;ee-poll-ses&rsquo; cookie from POST /poll</aside>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/poll <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY];ee-poll-ses=[TOKEN]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/poll</code></p>

<blockquote>
<p>Json Response</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"cameras"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"100e1e23"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"pre"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"20181121165011.233"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"event"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
