<h2 id="websocket-polling">WebSocket Polling</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>WebSockets provide a persistent connection between a client and server. This uplink enables a two-way data stream over which chunked data can be sent and received as messages. This protocol provides a full-duplex communications channel over a single TCP connection, allowing the client to receive event-driven responses without having to poll the server for a reply (effectively decreasing data traffic)</p>

<aside class="notice">The WebSocket similarity to the HTTP protocol is that its handshake is interpreted by HTTP servers as a HTTP &lsquo;upgrade request&rsquo;</aside>

<blockquote>
<p>Request Json</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"cameras"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"100e1e23"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"resource"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"pre"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"thumb"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"status"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"event"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"event"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
              </span><span class="s2">"MRBX"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"10097d15"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"resource"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"pre"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"thumb"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"status"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="s2">"event"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"event"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
              </span><span class="s2">"MRBX"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"&lt;object_id&gt;"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="client-handshake-request">Client Handshake Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET /api/v2/Device/00001007/Events HTTP/1.1</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Upgrade: websocket</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Connection: Upgrade</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Host: c000.eagleeyenetworks.com</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Origin: http://c000.eagleeyenetworks.com</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Sec-WebSocket-Key: dGhlIHNhbXBsZSBub25jZQ==</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Sec-WebSocket-Version: 13</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Cookie: auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]</code></p>

<p>The WebSocket protocol has two parts:</p>

<ul>
<li>Handshake (to establish the upgraded connection)</li>
<li>Data transfer</li>
</ul>

<p>The handshake process has to be initiated from the client side via a standard HTTP request <br>(HTTP version must be 1.1 or greater and the method must be GET)</p>

<table>
    <tr>
        <th colspan=7>The WebSocket request URL is composed in the following way:</th>
    </tr>
    <tr>
        <th style="text-align:center;">wss:&#47;&#47;</th>
        <th style="text-align:center;">c000.</th>
        <th style="text-align:center;">eagleeyenetworks.com</th>
        <th style="text-align:center;">&#47;api&#47;v2</th>
        <th style="text-align:center;">&#47;<a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Device')">Device</a></th>
        <th style="text-align:center;">&#47;00001007</th>
        <th style="text-align:center;">&#47;Events</th>
    </tr>
    <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">secure <br>websocket <br>protocol</td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">branded <br>subdomain</td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">server</td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">API version</td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">resource</td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">account ID</td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">&lsquo;Events&rsquo; suffix</td>
    </tr>
</table>

<p>WebSocket URLs use the WS scheme or alternatively WSS for secure connections which is the equivalent of HTTPS</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>A</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Used to replace the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key&#39;</code> cookie</td>
<td>false</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="server-handshake-response">Server Handshake Response</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Server: openresty</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Date: Wed, 08 Mar 2018 14:01:06 GMT</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">Connection: upgrade</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">upgrade: websocket</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">sec-websocket-accept: s3pPLMBiTxaQ9kYGzzhZRbK+xOo=</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">set-cookie: ee-ws-poll-ses=kjxZXVrDyIkK</code><br>
<code class="prettyprint">x-een-lb-tried-proxies: 209.94.238.21:80</code></p>

<p>The server reply completes the handshake. A successful server reply is followed by data transfer</p>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>101</td>
<td>Switching protocols</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Header is not understood or has an incorrect value</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="data-exchange">Data Exchange</h3>

<p>The client communicates with the server after a successful handshake by sending an object as Json-formatted string. The <em>message</em> send is being triggered by the client by calling the appropriate WebSocket <em>send</em> function (the method depends on the client environment)</p>

<p>The client has to specify via Json what kind of data it is going to be polling and from which devices (See <a href="#initialize-poll">Initialize Poll</a>, <a href="#poll">Resource Type</a>, <a href="#event-objects">Event Objects</a>)</p>

<p>WebSocket is an event-driven API. When messages are received a message event is delivered to the the <em>onmessage</em> function, where the message is being received and parsed</p>

<p>The connection can be severed at any given time using the <em>close</em> function</p>

<aside class="warning">A successful handshake can be established even with an incorrect data set in the Json-formatted string</aside>

<p>WebSocket polling will additionally return <em>message</em> response error codes for each individual encountered problem based on the <a href="#errors">Errors</a> section</p>

<h3 id="message-http-status-codes">Message HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>OK</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Invalid resource</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Access denied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>412</td>
<td>Auth lost</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

          <h1 id="annotation">Annotation</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>The Annotation service allows to push data (including HTML elements) into the <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Event')">Event</a> stream to add additional information about a camera/video. Annotations are associated with a <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Device')">Device</a> and a <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Timestamp')">Timestamp</a></p>

<aside class="notice">Annotations are subject to normal retention logic and as such will be discarded when the annotated time has exceeded retention</aside>

<!--===================================================================-->

<tr>
<td>d</td>
<td>Display</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Display parameter to choose if annotation should be displayed on the history browser timeline. Possible values are &ldquo;tick&rdquo;, &ldquo;span&rdquo;, or &ldquo;none&rdquo;. Default value = &ldquo;span&rdquo;</td>
<td>False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>l</td>
<td>Label</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Label to be displayed above bounding box</td>
<td>False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>lt</td>
<td>Line thickness</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Preferred, not guaranteed, line thickness of bounding box. Possible values are &ldquo;thin&rdquo;, &ldquo;normal&rdquo; or &ldquo;thick&rdquo;. Default value = &ldquo;thin&rdquo;</td>
<td>False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>sc</td>
<td>Box Stroke Color</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Preferred, not guaranteed, color as a web-safe hexadecimal value. #FFFFFF = white</td>
<td>False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>t</td>
<td>Text</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Text to be displayed as provided including newlines, line breaks, etc</td>
<td>False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>tt</td>
<td>Tool Tip</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Tooltip is to be displayed when the mouse hovers over pngSpan on timeline</td>
<td>False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>tw</td>
<td>Text line width</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Number of characters to display per line of text</td>
<td>True, if text is not null</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>u</td>
<td>URL</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>If supplied, the label will be rendered with the ability to link to the supplied URL</td>
<td>False</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<aside class="success">Please note that the model definition has property keys, but that&rsquo;s only for reference purposes since it&rsquo;s just a standard array</aside>

<h2 id="get-annotation">Get Annotation</h2>

<h2 id="create-annotation">Create Annotation</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Create an Annotation for a device with a specific timestamp and data describing it</p>

<aside class="notice">Annotations can only be created from within the account, where the device resides for which the annotation is being created</aside>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> PUT <span class="s2">"https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/annt/set?c=[DEVICE_ID]&amp;ts=[TIMESTAMP]&amp;ns=[NAMESPACE]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"[KEY_NAME]": "[ANNOTATION_DATA]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">PUT https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/annt/set</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Required</th>
</tr>

<tr>
<td><strong>c</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a> the annotation should be associated with</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong><a href="#data-attributes">&lt;data&gt;</a></strong></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object representing the data to be used as the annotation content (can include HTML elements)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>

<tr>
<td>ts</td>

</tr>

<td>ns</td>

<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
</tr>

    </span><span class="nl">"ns"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">11</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>

<h2 id="update-annotation">Update Annotation</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Update an Annotation for a device with a particular timestamp. Simple modifications (<code class="prettyprint">&#39;type=mod&#39;</code>) require to pass the original <code class="prettyprint">&#39;timestamp&#39;</code> from when the Annotation was created. Zero to N <code class="prettyprint">&#39;heartbeats&#39;</code> (<code class="prettyprint">&#39;type=hb&#39;</code>) can also be applied to describe changes over time for the Annotation</p>

<p>The Annotation can be ended at any given time by specifying an end event (<code class="prettyprint">&#39;type=end&#39;</code>), which closes the Annotation and allows to attach additional information. Each Annotation event is assumed to last for 10 seconds in the absence of a heartbeat extending it (After a heartbeat, it is assumed to last for another 10 seconds)</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST <span class="s2">"https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/annt/set?u=[UUID]&amp;c=[DEVICE_ID]&amp;ns=[NAMESPACE]&amp;ts=[TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"[KEY_NAME]": "[ANNOTATION_DATA]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">POST https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/annt/set</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>u</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Unique identifier (UUID) of the annotation being updated returned during Create Annotation</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>c</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a> associated with the annotation being updated</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>ts</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Timestamp associated with the annotation when originally created in EEN format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.NNN</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>ns</strong></td>
<td>int</td>
<td>The numerical namespace value assigned by Eagle Eye Networks (can be omitted for heartbeat events <code class="prettyprint">&#39;type=hb&#39;</code>)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong><a href="#data-attributes">&lt;data&gt;</a></strong></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object representing the data to be used as the annotation content (can include HTML elements)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>type</td>
<td>string, enum</td>
<td>The type of annotation update to make (defaults to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;mod&#39;</code>): <br><br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;mod&#39;</code> - simple modification of the annotation <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;hb&#39;</code> - indicates a heartbeat event, adding information on parameters that have changed and extending duration <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;end&#39;</code> - indicates the end of the event and updates the annotation if changes have been specified, no <code class="prettyprint">&#39;hb&#39;</code> with a later timestamp will be accepted <br><br>enum: mod, hb, end</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<blockquote>
<p>Json Response</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"uuid"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"595e4b9c-41f9-11e7-aaf2-0d5g1hafj2z6"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"cameraid"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"1000f60d"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"ts"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"20180526095435.831"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"ns"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">11</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-response-json-attributes">HTTP Response (Json Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>uuid</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Unique identifier of the annotation</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>cameraid</td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a> the annotation has been updated for</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>ts</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Timestamp associated with the annotation</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>ns</td>
<td>string</td>

</tr>
</tbody></table>

<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>

<tr>

<h2 id="next-annotation">Next Annotation</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns an object populated by Annotation events occurring <em>around</em> the defined timestamp by searching for the next event in the indicated direction (across create, update, hb, end events)</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/annt/annt/next <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[DEVICE_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"start_timestamp=[START_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/annt/annt/next</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera-ID')">Camera ID</a> the annotation is associated with</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>start_timestamp</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Timestamp as a point in time to get annotation event(s) after in EEN format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.NNN</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>end_timestamp</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Timestamp as optional limiter for the searched annotation event(s) in EEN format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.NNN (defaults to <em>now</em>). Matches events with identical start timestamps as the specified <code class="prettyprint">&#39;end_timestamp&#39;</code></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>namespace</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Namespace(s) as optional comma-separated limiter for the searched annotation event(s). Excludes all except for the specified namespace(s) by excluding results in both categories: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;new&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;active&#39;</code> (defaults to <em>include all</em>)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>uuid</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Unique identifier(s) as optional comma-separated limiter for the searched annotation event(s). Includes all except for the specified UUID(s) by excluding results from the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;new&#39;</code> category (defaults to <em>include all</em>)</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>flat</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Flatten the search results to merge heartbeats into the main annotation level and produce one consistent prolonged searchable event. No value is required <br><br>Example: <code class="prettyprint">&#39;flat=&#39;</code></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<blockquote>
<p>Json Response</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"ts"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"20180526095435.831"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"new"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="s2">"595e4b9c-41f9-11e7-aaf2-0d5g1hafj2z6"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="s2">"20180526095435.831"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"info"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Annotation by cafedead"</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"_end"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"20180526095440.831"</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="err">...</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"active"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="s2">"595e4b9c-41f9-11e7-aaf2-0d5g1hafj2z6"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="s2">"&lt;uuid&gt;"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="s2">"&lt;uuid&gt;"</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="http-response-json-attributes">HTTP Response (Json Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>ts</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Closest matching timestamp to the requested (to get annotations after) in EEN format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.NNN</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>new</td>
<td>array[array[obj]]</td>
<td>Array of arrays with each returned element being an annotation object with Json-formatted data <br>(See <a href="#annotation-model">Annotation Model</a> for the returned annotation array structure)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>active</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of all annotation UUIDs active around the specified <code class="prettyprint">&#39;st&#39;</code> (or within the defined time window)</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<aside class="notice">If the search criteria has not been matched by any events, the return will be <i>null</i></aside>

<h3 id="http-status-codes">HTTP Status Codes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>403</td>

<h2 id="previous-annotation">Previous Annotation</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Returns an object populated by Annotation events occurring <em>around</em> the defined timestamp by searching for the previous event in the indicated direction (across create, update, hb, end events)</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/annt/annt/prev <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[DEVICE_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"end_timestamp=[END_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>

<h2 id="window-of-annotations">Window of Annotations</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Return an object populated by active annotation events as a point in time (optionally including annotations that have recently ended). The result can be filtered (across create, update, hb, end events) by passing UUIDs to be excluded from the list. By specifying <code class="prettyprint">&#39;start_timestamp&#39;</code> the result will include any documents ended between <code class="prettyprint">&#39;start_timestamp&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;end_timestamp&#39;</code> (specifying <code class="prettyprint">&#39;start_timestamp&#39;</code> does not change the search interval)</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/annt/annt/window  <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[DEVICE_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"start_timestamp=[START_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"end_timestamp=[END_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

          <h1 id="png-span">Png Span</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This service offers native <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-PNG-Span')">PNG Span</a> rendering to support metric visualization. For spans the image is filled with the foreground color, where the specified span is active and with the background, where it is inactive. At least one pixel will be filled for a span independent of scale (the span may overlap others). For etags one pixel is filled for each active <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Event')">Event</a>, but the pixel may overlap others</p>

<h3 id="response-headers">Response Headers</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">&#39;content-location&#39;</code>: resource actually rendered, absolute start/end ts and either table/etag depending on whether an index was used</p>

<h3 id="use-cases">Use Cases</h3>

<p>The PNG span is a very efficient mechanism for visualizing where metrics and spans are active. Scale the image vertically as needed. PNG are extremely compact - a day of spans will be a few hundred bytes</p>

<p>The following description provides a typical use model:</p>

<ul>
<li>Tile the PNGs for fast, infinite scrolling. Render a width/timespan that represents a rational chunk of the current screen (i.e. 4h in a day view)

<ul>
<li>Fill the screen with tiles, fetch offscreen at the same size in preparation to scroll</li>
<li>Change origin of each entity to accomplish fast smooth scrolling</li>
<li>Fetch successive offscreen buffers as they come on screen</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Hit detection (for rollover) can be done in a browser by rendering opaque colors and reading pixels values from a one pixel high offscreen image

<ul>
<li>If an active pixel is detected, fetch the window of events around the timestamp estimate (since the pixel resolution is usually much less than the millisecond resolution needed for a timestamp) and use the response to determine what metric/span to display (i.e. the closest one)</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h3 id="png-type-list">PNG Type List</h3>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;setting&#39;</code>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;table=onoff&#39;</code> - <code class="prettyprint">&#39;camera_on&#39;</code> setting, the inverse of which represents camera <em>off</em></li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;purge&#39;</code>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;fflags=LOST&#39;</code> - filter for only purges the lost data (within retention window)</li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;span&#39;</code>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;table=video&#39;</code> - video recording on

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;fflags=STREAM&#39;</code> - filter for only streaming video</li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;table=motion&#39;</code> - motion detected (overall)

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;fflags=ALERTS&#39;</code> - filter for only motion that triggered alert</li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;table=roim&#39;</code> - roi motion detected

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;fflags=ALERTS&#39;</code> - filter for only roim that triggered alert</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;flname=roiid&#39;</code> - <code class="prettyprint">&#39;flval=roiid&#39;</code> value</li>
</ul></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;table=stream&#39;</code> - bridge is streaming from camera, the inverse of which represents camera <em>offline</em></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;table=register&#39;</code> - camera is registered with the cloud, the inverse of which represents <em>internet offline</em></li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="get-png-span">Get Png Span</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>PNG images can be retrieved for supporting metric visualization</p>

<h3 id="png-types">PNG Types</h3>

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;span&#39;</code></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;etag&#39;</code></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;event&#39;</code></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;setting&#39;</code></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">&#39;purge&#39;</code></li>
</ul>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/pngspan/etag.png <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"start_timestamp=[START_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"end_timestamp=[END_TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"width=[WIDTH]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[CAMERA_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"foreground_color=[COLOR_CODE]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"background_color=[COLOR_CODE]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"etag=[FOUR_CC]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span> <span class="nt">-v</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>

<p><small>Provide the &lsquo;<b>-O</b>&rsquo; option at the end of the request for file output to the current directory</small></p>

<p><small>Provide the &lsquo;<b>-o &ldquo;/&lt;file_path/&lt;filename&gt;.&lt;extension&gt;&rdquo;</b>&rsquo; option to specify output filename, path and extension</small></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/pngspan/{pngspan_type}.png</code></p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Camera ID</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>width</strong></td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Width in pixels of resulting PNG. Must be an integer greater than 0</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>start_timestamp</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Start Timestamp in EEN format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.NNN</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>end_timestamp</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>End Timestamp in EEN format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.NNN</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>foreground_color</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Color of foreground (active). If both foreground and background have 0 for alpha, assumed fully opaque (0xff) <br><br>Example (32 bit ARGB color): <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0xf0000000&#39;</code></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Color of background (inactive) <br><br>Example (32 bit ARGB color): <code class="prettyprint">&#39;0xffffffff&#39;</code></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>table</td>
<td>string, enum</td>
<td>If provided, specifies name of table to be rendered. Required for type <code class="prettyprint">&#39;span&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;event&#39;</code> <br><br>enum: stream, onoff, video, register</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>etag</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Identifies etag to be rendered, using the 4 character string identifier (<a href="#event-objects">Four CC</a>). Will utilize matching event tables where possible. Ignored for type <code class="prettyprint">&#39;span&#39;</code> and <code class="prettyprint">&#39;event&#39;</code></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>flval</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Identified value of the filter field from the starting etag. Only applicable for type <code class="prettyprint">&#39;span&#39;</code></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>flname</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Name of field within span start etag to match to flval. Interesting fields are roiid in roim table and videoid for video. Only applicable for type <code class="prettyprint">&#39;span&#39;</code></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>flflags</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Limits span rendering to spans with the flag asserted. ALERTS is asserted for roim and motion spans when an alert is active</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Status Code</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>200</td>
<td>Request succeeded</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>400</td>
<td>Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>401</td>
<td>Unauthorized due to invalid session</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404</td>
<td>Not found if camera, etag or table cannot be found</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

          <h1 id="layout">Layout</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Layout')">Layouts</a> contain panes, which are groups of <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Camera')">Cameras</a> arranged for viewing on screen. Layouts are associated with an <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Account')">Account</a> and <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-User')">Users</a> are granted view/write/share permissions for the Layout. Users who would otherwise have no access to a camera gain access to all cameras included in Layouts shared with them</p>

<p>Important information on accessing Layouts:</p>

<ul>
<li>Freshly created users get read-only permissions (<code class="prettyprint">&#39;R&#39;</code> letter in the Layout&rsquo;s permission string) to all Layouts existing for the account prior to user creation</li>
<li>A user will not have any access to newly created Layouts. Permissions must be assigned to them explicitly (Exception: users with <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_layout_admin=1&#39;</code> have unrestricted access to all Layouts existing or new)</li>
<li>Superusers and account superusers have unrestricted access to Layouts, which cannot be limited by Layout permissions</li>
</ul>

<aside class="notice">Layouts can only be created, listed or modified from within the account for which the Layout should be visible</aside>

<p>The ordering of the panes is determined by the order of the <a href="#layout-configuration-panes">configuration panes</a> returned by the API. Each pane will have a size of 1, 2, or 3. A size of 1 is the smallest and fills up 1x1 on the Layout grid. A size of 3 is the largest and fills up 3x3 on the Layout grid. If the grid does not have enough columns to fit the pane, then the size of the pane is decreased until it is able to fit on the grid</p>

<p>Rendered Layouts on Web and Mobile:
<img src="images/api_layout/example_1.png" alt="Example 1" width="1000">
<img src="images/api_layout/example_2.png" alt="Example 2" width="400"></p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h3 id="layout-attributes">Layout (Attributes)</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Property</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th style="text-align: center">Editable</th>
<th>Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>id</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Layout-ID')">Layout ID</a> automatically generated and assigned during creation</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#get-layout"><button>GET</button></form></sub></strong> <br><strong><sub><form action="#update-layout"><button>POST</button></form></sub></strong> <br><strong><sub><form action="#delete-layout"><button>DELETE</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>name</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Name of the layout</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#create-layout"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>types</strong></td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Specifies target(s) for layout. Multiple values are allowed</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#create-layout"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong><a href="#layout-configuration">configuration</a></strong></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of layout configuration</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td><strong><sub><form action="#create-layout"><button>PUT</button></form></sub></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>json</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Json encoded string. The same content as the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;configuration&#39;</code> field <small><strong>(DEPRECATED)</strong></small></td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>permissions</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>String of zero or more characters. Each character defines a permission that the current user has for the layout  <br><br>Permissions include: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;R&#39;</code> - user can view this layout <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;W&#39;</code> - user can modify this layout <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;D&#39;</code> - user can delete this layout <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;S&#39;</code> - user can share this layout</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>current_recording_key</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>String key representing a recording currently being made with the cameras in the layout, which was initiated using the action/recordnow service</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&cross;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>shares</td>
<td>array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;array&nbsp;[<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;string</br>&nbsp;&nbsp;]</br>]</td>
<td>Array of arrays each representing a user for whom sharing is enabled for this layout. Each string contains two comma-separated fields. The first field is a user ID and the second field are permissions for the user. Setting the first field to <code class="prettyprint">&#39;account&#39;</code> specifies that the layout is shared with all users of the account <br><br>Example: <br>[<code class="prettyprint">&#39;1005f2ed&#39;</code>,<code class="prettyprint">&#39;RWDS&#39;</code>] - user can view, change, delete or share this layout <br>[<code class="prettyprint">&#39;1005f2ed&#39;</code>,<code class="prettyprint">&#39;RW&#39;</code>] - user can view and change this layout <br>[<code class="prettyprint">&#39;1005f2ed&#39;</code>, <code class="prettyprint">&#39;R&#39;</code>] - user can view this layout <br><br>Permissions for the user issuing the /layout GET are not included in this array</td>
<td style="text-align: center"><strong>&check;</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="layout-configuration">Layout - configuration</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Is Required</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong><a href="#layout-configuration-panes">panes</a></strong></td>
<td>array[obj]</td>
<td>Array of Json objects with each object representing a pane structure</td>
<td>true</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><a href="#layout-configuration-settings">settings</a></td>
<td>json</td>
<td>Json object of layout settings</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="layout-configuration-panes">Layout - configuration - panes</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>name</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Layout pane name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>type</td>
<td>string</td>
<td>Layout types: <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;preview&#39;</code> - shows live preview images form cameras <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;carousel&#39;</code> - rotates between preview images, IDs of cameras need to be included in the cameras array along with an integer in the delay array. The delay is an integer value of milliseconds as too how long the Camera will be displayed before switching to the next Camera. A <code class="prettyprint">&#39;carousel&#39;</code> with only one camera is the same as preview <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;click&#39;</code> - respond to click for other cameras in layout <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;motion&#39;</code> - respond to motion for other cameras in layout <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;map&#39;</code> - a static map with camera icons located on it <br><code class="prettyprint">&#39;url&#39;</code> - displays the contents of the url in the pane as a frame</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>pane_id</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>ID given to pane when created by the Layout Manager</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>size</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Size of displayed image: <br><code class="prettyprint">1</code> - small <br><code class="prettyprint">2</code> - medium <br><code class="prettyprint">3</code> - large</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>cameras</td>
<td>array[string]</td>
<td>Array of camera IDs (For <code class="prettyprint">&#39;carousel&#39;</code> cycle through the camera IDs with the delay setting in the corresponding <code class="prettyprint">&#39;delay&#39;</code> property)</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<h3 id="layout-configuration-settings">Layout - configuration - settings</h3>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Data Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td>camera_border</td>
<td>boolean</td>
<td>Show camera pane borders</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_name</td>
<td>boolean</td>
<td>Show camera name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_aspect_ratio</td>
<td>float</td>
<td>Aspect ratio of images: <br><code class="prettyprint">0.5625</code> - 16x9 <br><code class="prettyprint">0.75</code> - 4x3</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>camera_row_limit</td>
<td>int</td>
<td>Max number of cameras to show per row: <br><code class="prettyprint">3</code> - 3 cameras per row <br><code class="prettyprint">4</code> - 4 cameras per row  <br><code class="prettyprint">5</code> - 5 cameras per row</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>custom_id</td>
<td>string</td>
<td><p hidden>???</p></td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

          <h1 id="terms-of-service">Terms of Service</h1>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="overview">Overview</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>The following API endpoints facilitate presenting and accepting the Terms of Service. By default, Eagle Eye Networks uses independent Terms of Service which will be presented through <a href="#get-terms-of-service-for-user">Get Terms of Service for User</a>. On the other hand resellers can use their own Terms of Service (instead of default ones) through <a href="#create-terms-of-service-for-account">Create Terms of Service for Account</a>. Switch between these two options can only be made by Eagle Eye Networks engineering staff.</p>

<p>Resellers can assign their own terms at the Master Account Level or give each <a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Sub-Account')">Sub-Account</a> custom terms at the Sub-Account Level</p>

<p>The basic workflow is as follows:</p>

<ol>
<li>Resellers create their own terms with the <a href="#create-terms-of-service-for-account">Create Terms of Service for Account</a></li>
<li><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Client')">Client</a> UI will display terms if not accepted from a <a href="#get-terms-of-service-for-user">Get Terms of Service for User</a></li>
<li><a class="definition" onclick="openModal('DOT-Client')">Client</a> UI will accept the terms from a <a href="#accept-terms-of-service-for-user">Accept Terms of Service for User</a></li>
</ol>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="get-terms-of-service-for-user">Get Terms of Service for User</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>This service allows to push important Terms of Service. The client software must call GET to see whether the user needs to agree to any new Terms of Service</p>

<p>If the user has a <code class="prettyprint">&#39;is_compliant=0&#39;</code>, the client software should popup a message box containing the Terms of Service
<br>(It is preferred to have this as a single combined message box)</p>

<p>If the user agrees to the terms, a PUT call should be placed containing an array of all the Terms of Service</p>

<aside class="notice">A past due user is subject to suspension of services and may not be allowed to login</aside>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/user/terms <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[USER_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<h2 id="create-terms-of-service-for-account">Create Terms of Service for Account</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Master accounts (Resellers) may require their own Terms of Service. This service allows to submit the text of customized Terms of Service</p>

<p>New terms can be submitted with a PUT command. GET can be done to verify the state of the terms. PUT will retire Terms of Service of the same title and account</p>

<aside class="notice">Only master accounts can create an account&rsquo;s Terms of Service</aside>

<p>Notices can be stored in the sub-account or the parent account of the user</p>

<p>Resellers are limited to 5 Terms of Service titles and each title will only have one active version</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> PUT https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/account/terms <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"is_admin_required": 1, "is_user_required": 1, "title": "[TERMS_TITLE]", "text": "[TERMS_TEXT]", "version": "[TERMS_VERSION]", "id": "[ACCOUNT_ID]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>

          <h1 id="faq">FAQ</h1>

<p><strong>Who can use the Eagle Eye APIs?</strong><br id=FAQ-001>
The Eagle Eye Video APIs are publicly open for anyone to use <br>Users will need a valid API key to successfully make API calls</p>

<p><strong>How do I get my API key?</strong><br id=FAQ-002>
You can get an API key by filling out the form</p>

<aside><form action="https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/api_signup.html"><button><b>&#128267;</b> Request API Key</button></form></aside>

<p><strong>I found an error with Eagle Eye Video API, where should I report it?</strong><br id=FAQ-003>
For API specific questions, issues or feature requests, please submit a request</p>

<aside><form action="https://www.eagleeyenetworks.com/support"><button><b>&#128030;</b> Report a Bug</button></form></aside>

<p><strong>How do you charge for the Eagle Eye Video API use?</strong><br id=FAQ-004>
The Eagle Eye Video API does not require any additional fees for use <br>The only fees are the per camera fees for the use of the Eagle Eye system</p>

<p><strong>What can I do with the Eagle Eye API?</strong><br id=FAQ-005>
The Eagle Eye Video API provides a robust set of storage, analytics, indexing and interfaces for quickly building or integrating applications with both live and recorded video. The applications can range from very simple to highly complex</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h3 id="curl">cURL</h3>

<p>Authenticate Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/authenticate <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s1">'{"username": "[USERNAME]", "password": "[PASSWORD]"}'</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"content-type: application/json"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<p>In this section we will walk you through the process of making API requests using the <strong>cURL</strong> command line tool. The Eagle Eye APIs are platform agnostic and we use them to create the web, Android and iOS Eagle Eye clients. Curl is a tool for transferring data to and from a server using a wide range of supported protocols including HTTP/HTTPS, which is what we are interested in</p>

<p><strong>cURL</strong> can be installed by visiting <a href="http://curl.haxx.se">this site</a> (present on most linux systems by default)</p>

<p>With cURL installed the next step is to log in and have a valid session (visit the <a href="https://ec.haxx.se/http-cheatsheet.html#curl-cheat-sheet">cURL cheat sheet</a> for basic HTTP commands), so that we can freely use any of the APIs. Logging in is a two step process consisting of authentication and authorization. The authentication API takes in 2 parameters. Our cURL common will look like the example (Authenticate Request) code to the right</p>

<aside class="notice">The <small>[USERNAME]</small> and <small>[PASSWORD]</small> need to be valid for the API request to return successfully</aside>

<ul>
<li>The <code class="prettyprint">--request</code> (or <code class="prettyprint">-X</code>) flag specifies the <em>type of request</em> and can be set to <em>GET</em>, <em>POST</em>, <em>PUT</em> and/or <em>DELETE</em></li>
<li>The <code class="prettyprint">--data</code> (or <code class="prettyprint">-d</code>) flag specifies the <em>data</em> (or in special cases <em>parameters</em>) of the API query</li>
<li>The <code class="prettyprint">-H</code> flag specifies the <em>headers</em> of the API query</li>
<li>The <code class="prettyprint">--cookie</code> flag specifies the <em>cookies</em> of the API query</li>
<li>Optionally provide the <code class="prettyprint">-v</code> flag for a <em>verbose output</em> (more detailed output including HTTP headers, cookies and full server response)</li>
<li>Optionally provide the <code class="prettyprint">-O</code> flag at the very end of the request for <em>file output</em> (displays download progress and saves the file with the name retrieved from the url to the current directory)

<ul>
<li>Alternatively provide <code class="prettyprint">&#39;-o &quot;/&lt;file_path/&lt;filename&gt;.&lt;extension&gt;&quot;&#39;</code> to specify output name and path <br>(path has to exist, can be relative <code class="prettyprint">&#39;./cam_01_recording.mp4&#39;</code>)</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<blockquote>
<p>A certain degree of variation is possible within cURL for formulating HTTP requests:</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/prev/image.jpeg <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[CAMERA_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]"</span> <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"asset_class=[ASSET_CLASS]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>

<p>Alternatively, the above request could be formulated as:</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">--request</span> GET <span class="s2">"https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/prev/image.jpeg?id=[CAMERA_ID]&amp;timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]&amp;asset_class=[ASSET_CLASS]&amp;A=[AUTH_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<p><strong>It is important to disassociate the types of request <em>data</em> from one another:</strong>
<br><small>(certain request types require data to be sent via <em>parameters</em>, other types require the data to be delivered via <em>data</em> - as HTTP body)</small></p>

<ul>
<li><strong>Parameters</strong> by providing the parameters following the request url with a <code class="prettyprint">?</code> and injecting them into it (i.e. <code class="prettyprint">id=[CAMERA_ID]&amp;timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]</code> in <code class="prettyprint">https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/prev/image.jpeg?id=[CAMERA_ID]&amp;timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]</code>)</li>
<li><strong>HTTP request body</strong> via <code class="prettyprint">--data</code> or <code class="prettyprint">-d</code> (i.e. <code class="prettyprint">-d &quot;id=[CAMERA_ID]&amp;timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]&quot;</code>)

<ul>
<li>Example: data in a standard PUT/POST request including <strong>Json-formatted data</strong>, which can be explicitly specified by adding the appropriate header <code class="prettyprint">-H &#39;Content-type: application/json&#39;</code> in the following way during a Create User call:

<ul>
<li><code class="prettyprint">-d &#39;{&quot;first_name&quot;: &quot;[FIRST_NAME]&quot;, &quot;last_name&quot;: &quot;[LAST_NAME]&quot;, &quot;email&quot;: &quot;[EMAIL]&quot;}&#39; -H &quot;content-type: application/json&quot;</code> <br>Alternatively the same data could be provided without specifying the data type in the following ways:</li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">-d &quot;first_name=[FIRST_NAME]&quot; -d &quot;last_name=[LAST_NAME]&quot; -d &quot;email=[EMAIL]&quot;</code></li>
<li><code class="prettyprint">-d &quot;first_name=[FIRST_NAME]&amp;last_name=[LAST_NAME]&amp;email=[EMAIL]&quot;</code></li>
</ul></li>
</ul></li>
<li><strong>HTTP headers or cookies</strong> (<code class="prettyprint">-H &quot;Authentication: [API_KEY]&quot; --cookie &quot;auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]&quot;</code>)</li>
</ul>

<p>The same request can frequently be mimicked using all 3 methods like with the <em>authentication key</em> in the following examples:</p>

<p><strong>Parameter (A=[AUTH_KEY])</strong></p>

<p><code class="prettyprint">curl -X GET &quot;https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/prev/image.jpeg?id=[CAMERA_ID]&amp;timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]&amp;asset_class=[ASSET_CLASS]&amp;A=[AUTH_KEY]&quot;</code></p>

<p><strong>Request body (-d &ldquo;A=[AUTH_KEY]&rdquo;)</strong>
<br><small>(sneaky way of forcing GET to accept parameters via the data field, in this case data is still pushed as parameters and not in the request body)</small></p>

<p><code class="prettyprint">curl -G https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/prev/image.jpeg -d &quot;id=[CAMERA_ID]&quot; -d &quot;timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]&quot; -d &quot;asset_class=[ASSET_CLASS]&quot; -d &quot;A=[AUTH_KEY]&quot; -H &quot;Authentication: [API_KEY]&quot;</code>
<br><small>or</small></br>
<code class="prettyprint">curl -X GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/prev/image.jpeg -d &quot;id=[CAMERA_ID]&amp;timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]&amp;asset_class=[ASSET_CLASS]&amp;A=[AUTH_KEY]&quot; -H &quot;Authentication: [API_KEY]&quot; -G</code></p>

<p><strong>Cookie (&ndash;cookie &ldquo;auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]&rdquo;)</strong></p>

<p><code class="prettyprint">curl -X GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/prev/image.jpeg -d &quot;id=[CAMERA_ID]&quot; -d &quot;timestamp=[TIMESTAMP]&quot; -d &quot;asset_class=[ASSET_CLASS]&quot; -H &quot;Authentication: [API_KEY]&quot; --cookie &quot;auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]&quot; -G</code></p>

<hr>

<h3 id="token">Token</h3>

<blockquote>
<p>Json Response</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"token"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Upon running this command with valid credentials, we receive a Json-formatted response containing a key/value pair for <code class="prettyprint">&#39;token&#39;</code>, which will look like the example (Json Response) on the right side</p>

<p>This token is a required parameter for making the authorize API request
<br><small>(Copy the value of the token in order to have it on hand when creating the authorize API request)</small></p>

<p><br><br><br><br><br><br><br></p>

<hr>

<h3 id="authorization">Authorization</h3>

<blockquote>
<p>Authorize Request</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-D</span> - <span class="nt">-X</span> POST https://login.eagleeyenetworks.com/g/aaa/authorize <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"token=[TOKEN]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<p>We can make the authorization API request using the example cURL command</p>

<p>The output are headers of the API request followed by the response body. The <code class="prettyprint">-D</code> flag is used to write the protocol headers. Here is the description from the man pages:</p>

<table><thead>
<tr>
<th>Argument</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead><tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>-D</strong>, â€“dump-header <file></td>
<td>Write the protocol headers to the specified file. This option is handy to use when you want to store the headers that a HTTP site sends to you. Cookies from the headers could then be read in a second cURL invocation by using the -b, â€“cookie option! The -c, â€“cookie-jar option is however a better way to store cookies</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>

<hr>

<blockquote>
<p>Get List of Devices Request (Authorized)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/device/list <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>
</blockquote>

<p>Note that <code class="prettyprint">&#39;-&#39;</code> after the <code class="prettyprint">-D</code> indicates that the output <em>file</em> is stdout. One of the header elements will be <code class="prettyprint">&#39;Set-Cookie: auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]&#39;</code>. Copy <code class="prettyprint">&#39;auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]&#39;</code> into the clipboard as this cookie will need to be set for all other API requests. The cURL request for getting a list of devices will look like in the example to the right</p>

<aside class="notice">The &lsquo;auth_key&rsquo; cookie will need to be set for any other Eagle Eye API that requires a valid session</aside>

    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="s2">"23535930-66eb-11e3-977b-ca8312ea370c"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">

    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">

<h3 id="http-request">HTTP Request</h3>

<p><code class="prettyprint">GET /layout/list</code>
<br><code class="prettyprint">GET /layout</code></p>

<p>When a user logs onto the Eagle Eye system, they are greeted with a grid of cameras, with each cell representing a camera pane. These panes can be of varying size so that the user can customize the layout to their liking. In this tutorial, we will demonstrate how to use the APIs to build these layouts so they are consistent on all platforms</p>

<p>While logged in, we make a request to the GET /layout/list API. This returns an array of Layout objects. Do note that this is not the same model as what is returned by the GET /layout API request. The one returned by the /layout/list API is an abridged version with only the most important attributes. The response of the request will look like this</p>

<p>We take the layout ID attribute for each layout of interest and pass it to the GET /layout API request. This will contain the information we need to construct the layout</p>

<blockquote>
<p>Get Layout (Request)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight shell tab-shell"><code>curl <span class="nt">-X</span> GET https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/g/layout <span class="nt">-d</span> <span class="s2">"id=[LAYOUT_ID]"</span> <span class="nt">-G</span> <span class="nt">-H</span> <span class="s2">"Authentication: [API_KEY]"</span> <span class="nt">--cookie</span> <span class="s2">"auth_key=[AUTH_KEY]"</span>
</code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p><em>For information on <strong>active_brand_subdomain</strong> click <a href="#active-brand-subdomain-explanation">here</a>.</em></p>

<p>Get Layout (Json Response)</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"811dbe48-66eb-11e3-8ca8-523445989f37"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"shares"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="s2">"ca0c35cb"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="s2">"SWRD"</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"mob dev 1"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"permissions"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"SWRD"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"current_recording_key"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"types"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="s2">"desktop"</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nl">"configuration"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"settings"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"camera_row_limit"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"automatic_rotation"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"camera_name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"camera_border"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"false"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nl">"camera_aspect_ratio"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"0.75"</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nl">"panes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"preview"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"pane_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Conference Room"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"cameras"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                    </span><span class="s2">"100f6136"</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"size"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"preview"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"pane_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"NW Parking"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"cameras"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                    </span><span class="s2">"10003254"</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
                </span><span class="nl">"size"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>We get a wealth of good information, but the information specific to setting up the pane layout is in the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;configuration&#39;</code> Json. Within that Json is an attribute called <code class="prettyprint">&#39;panes&#39;</code>, which is an array of individual pane objects. Each pane specifies the &lt;camera_id&gt; and the size of the pane. The size represents the width and height in number of cells. A size of 2 means that the pane is 2 cells in width and height, so it occupies a total of 4 cells. A size of 3 would occupy 9 cells</p>

<p>The other important factor to know is the size of grid holding the panes, specifically the number of columns. For the Eagle Eye web client a browser can be resized to be a narrow strip or the full width of the screen. The layout will dynamically adjust the number of columns based on the width of the window. Mobile devices have fixed screen sizes, so for the iOS and Android smartphone clients the number of columns is set to three</p>

<p>Now that we have the order of panes, the size of each pane and the size of the grid, we can construct our layout. This proved to be of varying difficulty depending on the platform. The web client uses a robust packing library <a href="http://metafizzy.co/blog/packery-released">Packery</a>, which is based on a bin packing algorithm. This library minimizes empty space while preserving the order as best as possible. Using Packery reduced the development time for this feature significantly</p>

<p>At this time Android does not have a robust library for packing the panes so the algorithm to do so was written from scratch. The goal was to mimic the Packery library as best as possible. The Android algorithm works as such:</p>

<ol>
<li>Remove the next image from the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;panes&#39;</code> array and place it in the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;panes_for_analysis&#39;</code> list</li>
<li>Analyze the panes in <code class="prettyprint">&#39;panes_for_analysis&#39;</code>. If there is a fully packed block, remove those panes and add them to the layout</li>
<li>If the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;panes&#39;</code> array is not empty, GOTO 1, else GOTO 4</li>
<li>Add the remaining panes from <code class="prettyprint">&#39;panes_for_analysis&#39;</code> to the layout</li>
</ol>

<p>This is the algorithm at a high level, though the specifics can get a little more complex, such as determining whether a fully packed block exists. The state of a fully packed block is also dependent on the number of columns for the grid</p>

<p>The ease of constructing layouts is highly dependent on the robustness of the 3rd party library. In the case that one does not exist, we fall back to our home-grown packing algorithm</p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="playing-live-video">Playing Live Video</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<p>Please see <a href="https://www.eagleeyenetworks.com/authentication-live-camera-preview-stream/" target="\_blank">this article</a> for a detailed version with reference material or continue in this section</p>

<p>Video playback functionality can be accessed through the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/asset/play/video.flv&#39;</code> API. We will show you how to use this API to play live video, though the same API can also be used to play historic video</p>

<p>Below is the Javascript code that creates the URL for playing live video footage with a HTML flash video player. You can run the javascript code on <a href="https://js.do">this site</a> to generate the URL string</p>

<p>The caller of the API need to supply 2 parameters. which are [DEVICE_ID] and [AUTH_KEY]. The [DEVICE_ID] represents the ID of the camera of interest. The [AUTH_KEY] is used for authentication and can be found in the response header of the <code class="prettyprint">&#39;/aaa/authorization&#39;</code> API</p>

<p><code class="prettyprint">
eagleEyeLiveVideoApiUrl = &quot;https://[active_brand_subdomain].eagleeyenetworks.com/asset/play/video.flv&quot; +
    &quot;?id=[DEVICE_ID]&quot; +
    &quot;&amp;start_timestamp=stream_&quot;+(new Date().getTime()) +
    &quot;&amp;end_timestamp=+300000&quot; +
    &quot;&amp;A=[AUTH_KEY]&quot;;
</code></p>

<!--===================================================================-->

<h2 id="long-polling">Long Polling</h2>

<!--===================================================================-->

<blockquote>
<p>Json Request for POST /poll</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight"><pre class="highlight json tab-json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
     </span><span class="nl">"cameras"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">

                 </span><span class="s2">"thumb"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"status"</span><span class="w">

             </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">

             </span><span class="nl">"resource"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"event"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"pre"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"thumb"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"status"</span><span class="w">
             </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
             </span><span class="nl">"event"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"ECON"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"ECOF"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"AELI"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"AELO"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
             </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="nl">"1009c1ab"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
             </span><span class="nl">"resource"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"event"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"pre"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"thumb"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"status"</span><span class="w">
             </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
             </span><span class="nl">"event"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"EMES"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"EMEE"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"CECF"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"CSAT"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"CSDT"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"CONN"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"COFF"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
                 </span><span class="s2">"ESES"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
